commit_message:
Enable overriding the service setup host python interpreter

In order to enable the service setup host python interpreter to
be changed easily, we make it a variable. This will be useful
when someone sets the service setup host to be the utility
container, because we'll be able to set this var by default.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/632125
Change-Id: I8ab51d6035d06fea1ee1d7d6427be03115f41924

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-12 22:21:20.000000000', 'message': 'Handle tags in _bury_in_cell0

We allowed add instance tags when booting in
Iac54b9627cb4398e45f1f15a2f4e7d6f86242093, conductor
will create tags for us in the selected cell, but
we forgot to consider the case that no valid host
was found.

So we will be unable to filter those instances in
cell0 with tags.

Change-Id: Idfe37d356b349024dfe963c934728111e1a1d314
closes-bug: #1806515
(cherry picked from commit 3cd439ad8a99f122566f0b5d0264ff5c8d34f998)
(cherry picked from commit cbb9eb5b056b96ea507d65fea0e32c27bbf6cdfa)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle tags in _bury_in_cell0

We allowed add instance tags when booting in
Iac54b9627cb4398e45f1f15a2f4e7d6f86242093, conductor
will create tags for us in the selected cell, but
we forgot to consider the case that no valid host
was found.

So we will be unable to filter those instances in
cell0 with tags.

Change-Id: Idfe37d356b349024dfe963c934728111e1a1d314
closes-bug: #1806515
(cherry picked from commit 3cd439ad8a99f122566f0b5d0264ff5c8d34f998)
(cherry picked from commit cbb9eb5b056b96ea507d65fea0e32c27bbf6cdfa)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-03 22:05:52.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly fail if trying to attach SR-IOV port

Attaching SR-IOV ports to existing instances is not supported
since the compute service does not perform any kind of PCI
device allocation, so we should fail fast with a clear error
if attempted. Note that the compute RPC API "attach_interface"
method is an RPC call from nova-api to nova-compute so the error
raised here will result in a 400 response to the user.

Blueprint sriov-interface-attach-detach would need to be
implemented to support this use case, and could arguably involve
a microversion to indicate when the feature was made available.

A related neutron docs patch https://review.openstack.org/594325
is posted for mentioning the limitation with SR-IOV port attach
as well.

Conflicts:
      doc/source/admin/pci-passthrough.rst

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
Ifb99e727110c4904a85bc4a13366c2cae300b8df in Queens.

Change-Id: Ibbf2bd3cdd45bcd61eebff883c30ded525b2495d
Closes-Bug: #1708433
(cherry picked from commit 68011c40ae2ab0900674408a88f62a60a802fef7)
(cherry picked from commit e1d55af4089fe6b76680285e36069ab0f57404ab)
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly fail if trying to attach SR-IOV port

Attaching SR-IOV ports to existing instances is not supported
since the compute service does not perform any kind of PCI
device allocation, so we should fail fast with a clear error
if attempted. Note that the compute RPC API "attach_interface"
method is an RPC call from nova-api to nova-compute so the error
raised here will result in a 400 response to the user.

Blueprint sriov-interface-attach-detach would need to be
implemented to support this use case, and could arguably involve
a microversion to indicate when the feature was made available.

A related neutron docs patch https://review.openstack.org/594325
is posted for mentioning the limitation with SR-IOV port attach
as well.

Conflicts:
      doc/source/admin/pci-passthrough.rst

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
Ifb99e727110c4904a85bc4a13366c2cae300b8df in Queens.

Change-Id: Ibbf2bd3cdd45bcd61eebff883c30ded525b2495d
Closes-Bug: #1708433
(cherry picked from commit 68011c40ae2ab0900674408a88f62a60a802fef7)
(cherry picked from commit e1d55af4089fe6b76680285e36069ab0f57404ab)

commit_message:
venv: use inventory_hostname instead of ansible_hostname

It is possible that the hostname of the system does not match the
one in the inventory which means that the delegate_to or the
comparision to inventory_hostname will fail in the tasks later.

Change-Id: Ifb477a405eef800b4aa224e05d882a8badf401a3

help figure out from which instance the meter is coming.

commit_message:
Switch functional testing to zaza

Drop amulet tests and create bundles for all target
Ubuntu/OpenStack series combinations inline with
current best practice.

Zaza tests are not a direct translation from the Amulet tests;
the new tests focus in Ceph RADOS Gateway and integration with
keystone rather than deploying compute, image and block
services (which do not make use of the ceph-radosgw charm).

Change-Id: I41914df024eb02e5a555bc0e44993e09d310933e

commit_message:
Reduce the dependencies, add more common Zuul jobs

The requirements files have been mostly copied from sahara.git,
but most of the dependencies are not needed.

Refresh the content of lower-constraints.txt and ensure that
the lower-constraints tox environment considers also the doc
dependencies.

Explicitly depend on the pre-release of Sahara for Stein.

Add few more jobs to avoid breakages, namely:
- add check-requirements and openstack-lower-constraints-jobs;
- replace tempest-plugin-jobs with openstack-python-jobs,
  openstack-python35-jobs and openstack-python36-jobs
  now that it is possible to depend on sahara.

Change-Id: I370490435d40a4a53e70d32a7a08e551a2c1ad54

commit_message:
Make fip topology check configurable

Horizon will by default check that a project has
a router with a port on an external network prior
to allowing floating ips to be attached to
instances. Since it is valid to use a shared
router from a different project we make this
configurable to allow disabling this check.

Closes-Bug: #1815032
Change-Id: I5c3e44e5daa683e14ac39979d6e9a7c2238dd120

commit_message:
Adding dependency for NetworkDeployment in 'server_resource_name'Deployment

We removed the dependency for NetworkDeployment[1] in
role.role.j2.yaml after moving to Ansible the
UpgradeInitCommand and UpgradeInitCommonCommand Heat hooks.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632108/17/puppet/role.role.j2.yaml@649

Closes-bug: 1812659
Change-Id: I2dae3358b56946aaae7eddbf3eb501e672455565
(cherry picked from commit aa2dc674fb3abdf4d5d2f1d41cc964cc32137b3c)

messages:
[{'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-01-29 15:58:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-01-29 16:00:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Tested on HA overcloud with the following:

1. deploy
2. record hash of mysql_restart_bundle
3. run update without changing password
4. verify that hashes didn't change and mysql isn't restarted
  - no restart log in /var/log/containers/mysql/mysqld.log
  - mysql_restart_bundle shouldn't be called
5. run update with password update
6. verify that hashes changed compared to previous run
  - mysql_init_bundle will recreate the new .my.cnf in config-data/puppet-generated
  - mysql_restart_bundle should be restarted by paunch due to config change
7. run update without changing password
8. verify that hash hasn't changed and no restart has happended
9. remove all config-data/puppet-generated/mysql/root/my.cnf on the hosts
10. run update without changing password
11. verify the file is recreated, hash didn't change and mysql is not restarted
  - docker-puppet should copy the missing file into both config/mysql and config/puppet-generated/mysql
  - mysql_init_bundle will succeed
  - mysql_restart_bundle shouldn't be called


I will test it for non-HA overcloud now and will report shortly"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-01-30 03:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-01-30 15:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-01-30 15:51:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Finished testing non-HA overcloud, password update works as expected, and password file gets recreated on update if it doesn't exists on the host"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-01-30 15:58:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-01-30 21:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-01-31 07:49:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

You mean the patch I proposed? It seems to work for me. I'm still trying to set up a split stack environment to confirm i can redeploy on a previously deployed environment.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-02-06 11:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-02-06 11:41:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

OK this morning I validated that deploying a split-stack on a node which already has a mysql DB works with this patchset. What I did:

1. create a stack (overcloud-baremetal) to deploy a server.
2. create a 2nd stack (overcloud) to deploy the openstack services on the server. Mysql gets bootstrapped and initialized with a default password.
3. delete the 2nd stack. the deployed server keeps running.
4. create a 3rd stack (overcloud) with another DB password. The services get recreated and the password is updated as expected.

PS: I forgot to mention yesterday that my test on the undercloud were done with that patchset + I9cc725c77fd9a2f9e55c4878cd2125f99f35c06d. revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-29 15:58:52.000000000', 'message': "Fix generation of configs that contain password files

In I8fe9a640ba36288a1f9cb18563b363159d4731c0 we added the ability
to prevent overwriting password files during docker-puppet runs, to
give the service the ability to update his own user credentials.

This doesn't work in case a stack update is running and config files
don't exist on the host in the first place, for instance due to
a previous deploy failure, or due to a controller node replacement.

Change the way password files are handled:

  . if a stack update is ongoing and a previous password file exists
    on the host, do not overwrite it with the new password. Only
    use the new password for computing the hash.

  . otherwise, always copy the newly generated password file on the
    host.

Also, fix the config hash generation that currently considers the
password file twice, which makes the hash vary and cause
unexpected service restart at each stack update.

Change-Id: Ia77f1a82c4164f53fa90a6f05ba728787622285d
Closes-bug: #1809145
"}, {'created': '2019-02-05 14:34:44.000000000', 'message': "Fix generation of configs that contain password files

don't exist on the host in the first place (e.g. because of a
previous deploy failure, or due to a controller node replacement).

commit_message:
Fix generation of configs that contain password files

In I8fe9a640ba36288a1f9cb18563b363159d4731c0 we added the ability
to prevent overwriting password files during docker-puppet runs, to
give the service the ability to update his own user credentials.

This doesn't work in case a stack update is running and config files
don't exist on the host in the first place (e.g. because of a
previous deploy failure, or due to a controller node replacement).
This also causes complications if a password file is already present
during a stack creation (e.g re-creating a stack on a split-stack
environment).

Change the way password files are handled:

  . if a previous password file exists on the host, do not overwrite
    it with the new password. Only use the new password for
    computing the hash.

  . otherwise, always copy the newly generated password file on the
    host.

Also, fix the config hash generation that currently considers the
password file twice, which makes the hash vary and cause
unexpected service restart at each stack update.

Change-Id: Ia77f1a82c4164f53fa90a6f05ba728787622285d
Closes-bug: #1809145

commit_message:
venv: use inventory_hostname instead of ansible_hostname

It is possible that the hostname of the system does not match the
one in the inventory which means that the delegate_to or the
comparision to inventory_hostname will fail in the tasks later.

Change-Id: If57ce8571a8104a5657581aaf6ff7934047e5085

commit_message:
Use application_url in API version document

this handles the possible vhost in Heat API path correctly
(like http://mucloud.com/heat-api) contrary to host_url.

Change-Id: I2f4dbb7d98fbdf5314d5771309919c5b25a72f94
Story: 2002531
Task: 22075

commit_message:
Fix releasenotes publishing after opendev/base-jobs change

This job uses a role in openstack-zuul-jobs, which is a repo that
used to be included in openstack's base job, but is no longer
now that we switched to the opendev base job.  This adds the repo
back to the role path for this job.

The failure is:
 ERROR! the role 'write-root-marker' was not found

Change-Id: I1f90a5a68b064ff24a325337d4c85dcfe4b07c7b

commit_message:
Move UpgradeInitCommand and UpgradeInitCommonCommand to run by Ansible

This change moves the execution of UpgradeInitCommand
and UpgradeInitCommonCommand to be executed with
Ansible in the upgrade step 0 instead of Heat.

Closes-bug: 1812659
Change-Id: I76eb6a2572e24b6f114e38897a68cd85276af3c6
(cherry picked from commit 9164e6adbdce69a2b7c10e1aea6c5cb309b6754e)
(cherry picked from commit 5753352ee7e600f30a67a196c3c8b3d06493257e)

commit_message:
Revert "Always attempt a graceful container stop/remove"

There is no --stop-signal, --stop-timeout options for the action stop (those are for run)

This reverts commit b5a14c6cd0be76156852afdc8c664e37e88bc7b3.

Change-Id: Id842ead687d36f6508eb8512692cde76bf914788

commit_message:
Rework nova_cell_v2_discover_host.py to use nova.conf and python novaclient

Previously nova_cell_v2_discover_host.py used environment variables passed
to the script and it got deleted right after usage. This changed to:
- read auth information from nova.conf
- read host information from nova.conf
- use python novaclient to check new services instead of subprocess
calls

Change-Id: Id08be90d6be89af66d94bc779f311702526eb788

commit_message:
Allow to set log facility for HAProxy

This change allows to get a better filtering at (r)syslog level, as
we can now dedicate a facility for this service.

Partial-Bug: #1814880

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-06 18:08:42.000000000', 'message': "[Refactor] Make caching BIOS settings explicit

Currently we cache BIOS setting after calling apply_configuration or
factory_reset implicitly via a wrapper added in BIOSInterface.__new__.
It's confusing, and we did forget about this aspect when writing
unit tests for the new iLO BIOS interface. This results in unsufficient
mocking that breaks unit tests with proliantutils installed.

This patch moves caching BIOS settings to an explicit decorator and
fixes the mocking problem.

Change-Id: I704eccea484b36cb5056fdb64d3702738c22c678
Story: #2004953
Task: #29375
"}]
commit_message:
[Refactor] Make caching BIOS settings explicit

Currently we cache BIOS setting after calling apply_configuration or
factory_reset implicitly via a wrapper added in BIOSInterface.__new__.
It's confusing, and we did forget about this aspect when writing
unit tests for the new iLO BIOS interface. This results in unsufficient
mocking that breaks unit tests with proliantutils installed.

This patch moves caching BIOS settings to an explicit decorator and
fixes the mocking problem.

Change-Id: I704eccea484b36cb5056fdb64d3702738c22c678
Story: #2004953
Task: #29375

commit_message:
step1: flatten nova service configuration

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files
into a single file that performs the docker service installation
and configuration. With this patch the baremetal version of
nova has been removed.

Change-Id: If8f4daa9127aa528a2088a978494f2d6d83106e2

commit_message:
Remove support for deploying Prometheus node-exporter

Kolla-Ansible now supports deploying Prometheus so we
no longer need this.

Story: 2004932
Task: 29320
Change-Id: I9242cf1ec7c19b135d7d7bdb9b803718b719ec58

commit_message:
Remove FWaaS v1 support

As it has been removed in neutron-fwaas. [1]

Also, remove logging_resource as it's only useful with FWaaS v1.

[1] I4e440c854e5aa11193d38946e659481f4fefded2

Partial-Bug: #1814625
Change-Id: I977d46722fc61e3ca160a08dc77754393111e887

commit_message:
Remove tempest plugin

These test cases has been moved to neutron-tempest-plugin repository.

This commit also includes the following unrelated change
to pass the gate.
----------------------------------------
Remove FWaaS v1 support

As it has been removed in neutron-fwaas. [1]

Also, remove logging_resource as it's only useful with FWaaS v1.

commit_message:
Workaround for installing correct version of ruby bundler

See https://github.com/bundler/bundler/issues/6870

Bundler 2.x dropped support for Ruby < 2.3 so now we detect ruby
version and install last known to work version. This means that
newer OS will get newer versions of bundler.

Closes-Bug: #1810401
  (cherry picked from commit 7acca40563ebde1696a95a4ab9f646b754edeeb2)

Change-Id: Ibd1ff419d13cace906d4cd9765dc7b5486bc19a7
(cherry picked from commit d83f041db993aaad63e21c25aef8a59ff5d04ba6)
(cherry picked from commit 44fa397d48e34ced89dd041ba1f0f02c12fb0079)

commit_message:
Workaround for installing correct version of ruby bundler

See https://github.com/bundler/bundler/issues/6870

Bundler 2.x dropped support for Ruby < 2.3 so now we detect ruby
version and install last known to work version. This means that
newer OS will get newer versions of bundler.

Closes-Bug: #1810401
  (cherry picked from commit 7acca40563ebde1696a95a4ab9f646b754edeeb2)

Change-Id: Ibd1ff419d13cace906d4cd9765dc7b5486bc19a7
(cherry picked from commit d83f041db993aaad63e21c25aef8a59ff5d04ba6)

commit_message:
Make event_sink publisher configurable

The charm currently configures events to be published to
rabbit on both the config.event_topic (event.sample queue)
and alarm topic but as of Queens Ceilometer no longer
consumes event.sample. This patch makes the event_sink
publishers configurable and defaults to publishing to
aodh to retain backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I5b55f31adcf2b069ff51e387a416f9f1ac4099f8
Partial-Bug: #1676586

commit_message:
Allow user to generate urls for the given results.

Introduce the flag `--url` who allow user to generate urls
for the given result.

Introduce the option `--distgit` to allow user to specify
the base url to use to generate urls.

Change-Id: I10d4f92f64a68f283c70c2c880c27a069f123762

commit_message:
Workaround for installing correct version of ruby bundler

See https://github.com/bundler/bundler/issues/6870

Bundler 2.x dropped support for Ruby < 2.3 so now we detect ruby
version and install last known to work version. This means that
newer OS will get newer versions of bundler.

Change-Id: I521affb16d8d2312be3ff507a014adddacd6cb8b
Closes-Bug: #1810401
(cherry picked from commit 618537771344aa91cc12759dbab1b63acf55ec6d)

[{'created': '2019-02-01 10:11:27.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure dnsmasq is down before enabling it in restart method

Dnsmasq driver used by dhcp agent has restart() method which is
calling disable() and then enable() dnsmasq process again.
What can be observed in functional tests from time to time it may
happen that start dnsmasq process will be called before old process
is really down. That leads to error that IP address to which
dnsmasq wants to bind is already in use and it fails to start.

This patch adds possibility to call disable() method with block flag
set to True. In such case driver will ensure in disable() method that
process is really not active.
This blocking disable() is used in restart() method now.

Change-Id: I419a451633badbc3d32edcee1945fca3e3d9f6be
Closes-Bug: #1811126
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure dnsmasq is down before enabling it in restart method

Dnsmasq driver used by dhcp agent has restart() method which is
calling disable() and then enable() dnsmasq process again.
What can be observed in functional tests from time to time it may
happen that start dnsmasq process will be called before old process
is really down. That leads to error that IP address to which
dnsmasq wants to bind is already in use and it fails to start.

This patch adds possibility to call disable() method with block flag
set to True. In such case driver will ensure in disable() method that
process is really not active.
This blocking disable() is used in restart() method now.

Change-Id: I419a451633badbc3d32edcee1945fca3e3d9f6be
Closes-Bug: #1811126

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 07:44:26.000000000', 'message': "Fix translation jobs due to opendev/base-job change

These jobs uses a role in openstack-zuul-jobs, which is a repo that
used to be included in openstack's base job, but is no longer
now that we switched to the opendev base job.  This adds the repo
back to the role path for this job.

Failure is:
ERROR! the role 'prepare-zanata-client' was not found...

Change-Id: Id23965a2d43e555fe1f6c33de1381813fdf7239c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix translation jobs due to opendev/base-job change

These jobs uses a role in openstack-zuul-jobs, which is a repo that
used to be included in openstack's base job, but is no longer
now that we switched to the opendev base job.  This adds the repo
back to the role path for this job.

Failure is:
ERROR! the role 'prepare-zanata-client' was not found...

Change-Id: Id23965a2d43e555fe1f6c33de1381813fdf7239c

commit_message:
Adding dependency for NetworkDeployment in 'server_resource_name'Deployment

We removed the dependency for NetworkDeployment[1] in
role.role.j2.yaml after moving to Ansible the
UpgradeInitCommand and UpgradeInitCommonCommand Heat hooks.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632108/17/puppet/role.role.j2.yaml@649

commit_message:
pip-and-virtualenv: handle centos image-based builds

This fixes a regression in I041a141366099093805e6052b1bbf64efd277e1e
where we starting skipping the removal of old files for image-based
builds (confusingly named centos7 rather than centos for historical
reasons).  Fix the check

Change-Id: I74688a9e91d833b5d654056431729bed0585616c

the ceilometer-upgrade action is required whenever gnocchi is related to
ceilomter.

commit_message:
Fix deployment of gluster with openshift AllInOne

When TripleO deploys openshift with CNS, it configures it to setup
gluster for both the worker nodes and the image registry. However, the
code was incorrectly adding the glusterfs_registry group only for the
Infra node and was forgetting about the AllInOne role.

Closes-Bug: #1811334
Change-Id: Ib502a28db4d67434686a058562a37d1e1df3e263

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-30 03:16:33.000000000', 'message': "WIP Check if mysql bootstrap is done for root password update

We don't bootstrap mysql if it's aready done i.e check for
/var/lib/mysql/mysql in mysql_bootstrap. This check would
fail after an overcloud delete as the mysql container may be
still running on the deployed servers. We should atleast use
the same logic when updating mysql root password, else
docker-puppet-mysql_init_tasks would try to use the new root
password and fail.

This would require mounting /var/lib/mysql in docker-puppet*,
which is possibly little inefficient.

Change-Id: Icf55fdbe0c36d86da774b5c0d1ca206d3672c8b2
Closes-Bug: #1813299
"}, {'created': '2019-02-04 08:55:40.000000000', 'message': "Check if mysql bootstrap is done for root password update

We don't bootstrap mysql if it's aready done i.e check for
/var/lib/mysql/mysql in mysql_bootstrap container. This check
would fail after an overcloud delete as the mysql container may
be still running on the deployed servers. We should atleast use
the same logic when updating mysql root password, else
docker-puppet-mysql_init_tasks would try to use the new root
password and fail.

Change-Id: Icf55fdbe0c36d86da774b5c0d1ca206d3672c8b2
Closes-Bug: #1813299
"}]
commit_message:
Check if mysql bootstrap is done for root password update

We don't bootstrap mysql if it's aready done i.e check for
/var/lib/mysql/mysql in mysql_bootstrap container. This check
would fail after an overcloud delete as the mysql container may
be still running on the deployed servers. We should atleast use
the same logic when updating mysql root password, else
docker-puppet-mysql_init_tasks would try to use the new root
password and fail.

Change-Id: Icf55fdbe0c36d86da774b5c0d1ca206d3672c8b2
Closes-Bug: #1813299

commit_message:
Parameter changed from mgmt_url to mgmt_ip_address

At present the VNF mgmt IP address is assigned to parameter name
of "mgmt_url". In this patch it is changed to "mgmt_ip_address"
which will be relevant one

Co-Authored-By: Dharmendra Kushwaha <dharmendra.kushwaha@india.nec.com>

Change-Id: I621b71d4af96a4bfa0f27442efe4d302c5afa96d
Partial-Bug: #1648327

commit_message:
[docs] OOB RAID implementation for ilo5 based HPE Proliant servers

Adds documentation for OOB RAID implementation using new hardware
type ``ilo5``.

Change-Id: Iafda73900b9ebca34642e6340a114f1fa7aff86d
Story: 2003349
Task: 24391

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-05 00:44:23.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Export images to be served by httpd

This change detects whether a registry supports the push API, and if
it does not then exports the images to /var/lib/tripleo-image-serve to
be served by Apache.

The httpd conf to replicate the push portion of the registry API is as
follows:

Listen 8787
<VirtualHost *:8787>
    DocumentRoot /var/lib/tripleo-image-serve

    <Directory /var/lib/tripleo-image-serve>
        # This assumes a file exists containing {} at
        # /var/lib/tripleo-image-serve/index.json
        DirectoryIndex index.json

        Options +MultiViews
        AllowOverride FileInfo
        Require all granted

        Header set Docker-Distribution-Api-Version registry/2.0
    </Directory>

    <LocationMatch "^/v2/.*/.*/blobs/sha256:.*$">
        SetEnvIf Request_URI "sha256:(.*)$" digest=sha256:$1
        Header set Docker-Content-Digest "%{digest}e"
        Header set ETag "%{digest}e"
        Header set Cache-Control "max-age=31536000"
        Header set Content-Type "application/octet-stream"
    </LocationMatch>
</VirtualHost>

TODO
- unit tests
- deploy and configure a container image running only httpd
- cross-repo mount implementation

Change-Id: I48e23c8078847c9d69eeda64fad3f76f9d02dc9d

commit_message:
Export images to be served by httpd

This change detects whether a registry supports the push API, and if
it does not then exports the images to /var/lib/image-serve to
be served by Apache.

Blueprint: podman-support
Change-Id: I48e23c8078847c9d69eeda64fad3f76f9d02dc9d

commit_message:
Make transfer and persist modules, trailing slash insensitive.

In those modules adding a trailing slash to the src or dest directory
would cause tar to fails.  This cleanup the name by making sure we
never have a trailing "/".

Change-Id: I0da33a43935ec7559b6084a1ee9c75a785d9e5b1
Implements: blueprint upgrades-with-os

commit_message:
Add missing dirs

We can see some contribution directory is missing which
exist parallel to other directories. Adding this information
to README is helpful for new contributors to understand
high level directory structure.

Change-Id: I4ed50b49aac1e9ab21957f4ec3da1b33883ad9b1

commit_message:
Use stestr instead of testr

Moved tests to where stestr can find them.

Updated flavor and image retrieval to handle all OpenStack
Exceptions.

Change-Id: Ic322e57dd7dc7eb7b5cebdd572ab5b0217f2647b

commit_message:
Publish error for package_update workflow

The package_update workbook need to publish the execption
when something failed with heat stack update

Manual Cherry pick from:
I8db298e885e110f1b8852893b76b36d3465df6c2

Change-Id: I8db298e885e110f1b8852893b76b36d3465df6c2

commit_message:
Remove basepython from [flake8] section

basepython is not a valid option for flake8 and
it is complaned when running tox -e pep8.
It seems to have been added accidentally.

Change-Id: Ia5d093bab0c175b2693e7ae47a6bc29c1d44db36

commit_message:
curl install-deps if needed

In order to not break the use case
where quickstart.sh is downloaded as a standalone
file, install-deps must be downloaded.

Change-Id: I4c333395c7d468272b5258fedd6c847fa944ef65

commit_message:
Update from OS::Glance::Image to OS::Glance::WebImage

Currently, OS::Glance::Image is deprecated in Heat [1]. Heat now
supports glance web-download [2].

This patch will add support glance web-download to fix issue for
image resource.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/heat/latest/template_guide/unsupported.html#OS::Glance::Image
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/617915

Change-Id: Ib95ed31c70073cb732d41defe5bdc8027eadfeec

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-01 02:13:04.000000000', 'message': 'Search ports with matching subnet

On ipam_request_address, it will try to find existing Neutron
ports if any. If there is no existing Neutron ports, kuryr will
create one. Kuryr will search ports with matching IP address first.
If the first search is not successful, it will do a second search
to find ports with matching mac address.
This commit improve the second search by matching the subnet_id
as well as the mac address. This is because things will go wrong
if the port is in a different subnet (e.g. an ipv6 address is
requested while the port is in a v4 subnet).

Change-Id: I1eaa9c87079f1c57babbe08ae52ed69a44cfa9aa
Related-Bug: #1800375
(cherry picked from commit 542cb5aabd73a7bf9865dacd68f484aea49ae71e)
'}]
commit_message:
Search ports with matching subnet

On ipam_request_address, it will try to find existing Neutron
ports if any. If there is no existing Neutron ports, kuryr will
create one. Kuryr will search ports with matching IP address first.
If the first search is not successful, it will do a second search
to find ports with matching mac address.
This commit improve the second search by matching the subnet_id
as well as the mac address. This is because things will go wrong
if the port is in a different subnet (e.g. an ipv6 address is
requested while the port is in a v4 subnet).

Change-Id: I1eaa9c87079f1c57babbe08ae52ed69a44cfa9aa
Related-Bug: #1800375
(cherry picked from commit 542cb5aabd73a7bf9865dacd68f484aea49ae71e)

Closes-Bug: #1814852
'}]
commit_message:
Disable tacker for scenario007

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633546 changed the path of
tacker service deployment from docker/services/tacker.yaml to
deployment/tacker/tacker-container-puppet.yaml but not updated
in environments files, leading to failure during overcloud
deployment. Also now tacker is containerize by default but this is a wip
[1] so we disable here for sceanrio007 while work is finished

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1714270

Change-Id: Ic802a2ca60ee26a805731a6a64df3c51cde44d6a
Closes-Bug: #1814852

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-04 21:31:25.000000000', 'message': "Use X-Forwarded-Proto as origin protocol if present

When using a haproxy with SSL termination to provide secure console
connections, haproxy will change the Origin header scheme to 'http'
and add the 'X-Forwarded-Proto: https' header. This causes a failure
in the Nova console proxy code which verifies that the Origin header
scheme matches the access_url scheme for the connection, because the
Origin header coming from haproxy is 'http' while the access_url
scheme is 'https' or 'wss'.

This looks for the X-Forwarded-Proto header and uses its scheme for
the verification instead, if it is present.

Closes-Bug: #1788180

Change-Id: I43401dc8368853654bf443273a0a1b5b9b63e3f0
(cherry picked from commit 890e2d320e8e8e7b501af8e21cc6b751fb204d04)
"}]
commit_message:
Use X-Forwarded-Proto as origin protocol if present

When using a haproxy with SSL termination to provide secure console
connections, haproxy will change the Origin header scheme to 'http'
and add the 'X-Forwarded-Proto: https' header. This causes a failure
in the Nova console proxy code which verifies that the Origin header
scheme matches the access_url scheme for the connection, because the
Origin header coming from haproxy is 'http' while the access_url
scheme is 'https' or 'wss'.

This looks for the X-Forwarded-Proto header and uses its scheme for
the verification instead, if it is present.

Closes-Bug: #1788180

Change-Id: I43401dc8368853654bf443273a0a1b5b9b63e3f0
(cherry picked from commit 890e2d320e8e8e7b501af8e21cc6b751fb204d04)

place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to

tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks called from tox,
documentation and packaging builds, et cetera).

commit_message:
[Configuration] Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools.

To this end, remove the long-standing sections for "Mr Developer"
and "Editors" since their mere existence here sends the signal that
we welcome (and have time to review) additions for any old tool
someone ever might happen to try. Also add a comment block
explaining this, for clarity.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks called from tox,
documentation and packaging builds, et cetera).

Change-Id: I4774772ec30611b0acd1ad2aadcf6a1a3f93938c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-01 13:53:32.000000000', 'message': 'Don't specify exactly IP in portforwarding functional test

In Port Forwarding functional tests, port is created in setUp()
method. This port had specified exactly IP address and subnet to use
and sometimes that caused "409 conflict" response from Neutron.

This patch changes it and now only subnet id is specified. IP
address for port will be choosen by Neutron's IPAM driver.

Change-Id: Iee2f72acf6814a0f8f76d240862429a8b63c3b09
Closes-bug: #1813540
'}, {'created': '2019-02-04 05:34:39.000000000', 'message': 'Don't specify exactly IP in portforwarding functional test

In Port Forwarding functional tests, port is created in setUp()
method. This port had specified exactly IP address and subnet to use.
This was proposed in [1] to fix issue when new port created in same
subnet got sometimes IP address outside of subnet range.
Unfortunatelly that fix was not enough and caused other issues
as sometimes this "fixed" IP address used for port might be
used e.g. by router_interface port and that caused sometimes
"409 conflict" response from Neutron sometimes.

This patch adds additional method in
neutron.tests.unit.db.test_db_base_plugin_v2 module to find first
free IP address from given subnet.
This method is now used in port forwarding tests module to choose
IP address for second created port in the subnet so there should be
no conflicts with IP addresses anymore.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/631815

Change-Id: Iee2f72acf6814a0f8f76d240862429a8b63c3b09
Closes-bug: #1813540
'}]
commit_message:
Don't specify exactly IP in portforwarding functional test

In Port Forwarding functional tests, port is created in setUp()
method. This port had specified exactly IP address and subnet to use.
This was proposed in [1] to fix issue when new port created in same
subnet got sometimes IP address outside of subnet range.
Unfortunatelly that fix was not enough and caused other issues
as sometimes this "fixed" IP address used for port might be
used e.g. by router_interface port and that caused sometimes
"409 conflict" response from Neutron sometimes.

This patch adds additional method in
neutron.tests.unit.db.test_db_base_plugin_v2 module to find first
free IP address from given subnet.
This method is now used in port forwarding tests module to choose
IP address for second created port in the subnet so there should be
no conflicts with IP addresses anymore.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/631815

Change-Id: Iee2f72acf6814a0f8f76d240862429a8b63c3b09
Closes-bug: #1813540

commit_message:
Add tempest_plugin entry to setup.cfg

This commit adds tempest_plugin entry to setup.cfg to run tempest
list-plugins and tempest run -l without its source code repo existence.
Otherwise, we face an error like below.

  Could not load 'ngs_tests':
        No module named tempest_plugin.plugin

Change-Id: I2ad4c4d665bef3405538c3ea51dc4d3ee83dd187

commit_message:
Fix port update deferred IP allocation with host_id + new MAC

IP allocation was initially deffered due to lack of binding
information. On port update the with both `mac_address` and
`binding_host_id`` in the request 'fixed_ips: []' was
appended to the new_port data. This caused the check for
fixed_ips_requested to return True, which in turn cause
deferred_ip_allocation to evaluates False.

Only set the new_port default fixed_ips to original_ips if
the original port had fixed_ips.

Closes-Bug: #1811905
Change-Id: If98a82f8432b09a29f9d0cc6627e9649b43bc4a1
(cherry picked from commit b0d758e1b4af9aed8c2da6e0bac4723d8e4f5443)

Bug #1244589 re-appeared for IPv6.

This change adds an ip6tables rule to fix the checksum of DHCPv6
response packets. Those checksums were left unfilled by virtio (as a
hypervisor internal optimization), but some picky dhcp clients (AFAIU
particularly ISC dhclient) try verifying the checksums, so they fail
to acquire an address if the checksums are left incorrect.

commit_message:
Always fill UDP checksums in DHCPv6 replies

Bug #1244589 re-appeared for IPv6.

This change adds an ip6tables rule to fix the checksum of DHCPv6
response packets. Those checksums were left unfilled by virtio (as a
hypervisor internal optimization), but some picky dhcp clients (AFAIU
particularly ISC dhclient) try verifying the checksums, so they fail
to acquire an address if the checksums are left incorrect.

Change-Id: I4a045e0dcfcbd3c7959a78f1460d5bf7da0252ff
Closes-Bug: #1811639
Related-Bug: #1244589
(cherry picked from commit 26eb2509fea632e67ffabcc15195cc13ee02bf68)

commit_message:
Always fill UDP checksums in DHCPv6 replies

Bug #1244589 re-appeared for IPv6.

This change adds an ip6tables rule to fix the checksum of DHCPv6
response packets. Those checksums were left unfilled by virtio (as a
hypervisor internal optimization), but some picky dhcp clients (AFAIU
particularly ISC dhclient) try verifying the checksums, so they fail
to acquire an address if the checksums are left incorrect.

Change-Id: I4a045e0dcfcbd3c7959a78f1460d5bf7da0252ff
Closes-Bug: #1811639
Related-Bug: #1244589
(cherry picked from commit 26eb2509fea632e67ffabcc15195cc13ee02bf68)

commit_message:
venv: use inventory_hostname instead of ansible_hostname

It is possible that the hostname of the system does not match the
one in the inventory which means that the delegate_to or the
comparision to inventory_hostname will fail in the tasks later.

Change-Id: Iad93fc19b8b0a2e857064f4c69f63b9aa2baba7a

It also removes the "no_author_tags" check as it is now covered in the
main hacking rule H105.

> I'm getting a manage_error when attempting to manage the share
 > after it has been unmanaged. How can I get more details about the
 > reason for the error?
 > 
 > The screen-m logs don't contain anything that seems to be
 > relevant..

You may want to look at the Manila API and Manila Scheduler service logs to see what went wrong there. I'd check the Scheduler log first for any sort of errors with the management of the share. You may also want to look at how the Manage Share operation is implemented in the API tests and use that for a baseline to implement it for the scenario tests (if not just reuse that method as it is if possible)"}, {'account_id': 26535, 'date': '2018-07-31 20:21:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

Hey Nir, 

Since we're iterating through these tests, we should try to test the patch locally with a Devstack. The same configuration for ZFSOnLinux driver is here [1]. 

Another approach we can take to avoid wasting gate resources is to temporarily disable all other test jobs and only enable the ZFSOnLinux job. We know this test currently applies only to the ZFSOnLinux job, so you can do this by editing .zuul.yaml in manila_tempest_tests and replacing the check queue with:

     check:
      jobs:
        - manila-tempest-dsvm-postgres-zfsonlinux


So only that job is run. When we're satisfied we have written up the test well, we can revert the change to .zuul.yaml and test against all other jobs. 

Thanks for persisting through this and getting this done."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-01-28 17:53:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 23:52:02.000000000', 'message': 'api-ref: Correct response body type for show host details

Currently [0] claims that "total_volume_gb" in the response body
is of type int -- but it is actually a string, going off the example
response body as well as the API code, which clearly casts the
value to a str() [1].

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html?expanded=show-host-details-for-a-project-detail#show-host-details-for-a-project
[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/95d6d49b01cfdd18505069098e1fa9e5763a99b5/cinder/api/contrib/hosts.py#L169

Change-Id: I36486724cc30389d371ec0b18b9b7f96883d193c

commit_message:
api-ref: Correct response body type for show host details

Currently [0] claims that "total_volume_gb" in the response body
is of type int -- but it is actually a string, going off the example
response body as well as the API code, which clearly casts the
value to a str() [1].

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html?expanded=show-host-details-for-a-project-detail#show-host-details-for-a-project
[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/95d6d49b01cfdd18505069098e1fa9e5763a99b5/cinder/api/contrib/hosts.py#L169

Change-Id: I36486724cc30389d371ec0b18b9b7f96883d193c

The utils.trace helper is logging the args list to

commit_message:
Mask passwords in utils.trace for func params

The utils.trace helper is logging the args list to
the decorated function but is not masking passwords
in those args. This change adds a call to mask passwords
in the function args list.

Synchronize from os_brick.utils.trace.

Change-Id: I1c0b5d22258416b7cd2d84fafc339a1308ff34ab

Remove 'lvrename' from rootwrap

Use oslo.privsep to use 'lvrename'.

Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-12-07 03:18:28.000000000', 'message': 'WiP: Allow obvtaining specifically tagged governance data

Change-Id: Ib94d5f0c3df8538af753b3b46c6a11ceff8fef53
'}, {'created': '2018-12-19 07:14:53.000000000', 'message': 'WiP: Allow obvtaining specifically tagged governance data

Change-Id: Ib94d5f0c3df8538af753b3b46c6a11ceff8fef53
'}, {'created': '2019-01-14 03:10:13.000000000', 'message': "Allow obtaining specifically tagged governance data

The Election repo need to collect governance data at a specific tag.
Allow this for remote (governance) repos.  We don't need to do this for
a local (governance) review as we can just ``git checkout`` the tag.

Change-Id: Ib94d5f0c3df8538af753b3b46c6a11ceff8fef53
"}]
commit_message:
Allow obtaining specifically tagged governance data

The Election repo need to collect governance data at a specific tag.
Allow this for remote (governance) repos.  We don't need to do this for
a local (governance) review as we can just ``git checkout`` the tag.

Change-Id: Ib94d5f0c3df8538af753b3b46c6a11ceff8fef53

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-05 16:12:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix the subprocess invocation of neutron-l3-agent

neutron-l3-agent tries to invoke neutron-keepalived-state-change
from it's PATH. The venv's bin directory is not part of the
default PATH of the neutron-l3-agent, hence the invocation fails.
This change adds the venv's bin directory to the PATH of
neutron-l3-agent.

To the best of my knowledge this is currently the only script
which is invoked and shipped by neutron itself [1]. Neutron expects
quite a few binaries in it's PATH, however other expected binaries
are typically system packages (e.g. radvd) [2].

Sadly, the PATH can not easily be extended, hence all non venv-bin
directories from the PATH are a 'one-time snapshot' from a quite
common set of directories across all common linux distributions.

[1]
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/search?q=%22cmd+%3D+%27neutron-%22&unscoped_q=%22cmd+%3D+%27neutron-%22
[2]
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/search?q=external_process.ProcessManager&unscoped_q=external_process.ProcessManager

Depends-On: I504a8270be1ddf2f24ab3ad3b4f2f4ca9c990470
Change-Id: I38bb573468dd4c57523cc1a5ff2448009ee2b216
(cherry picked from commit bf00f1d610cd3790ec32f2252e7bd2ecb4b10ed9)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the subprocess invocation of neutron-l3-agent

neutron-l3-agent tries to invoke neutron-keepalived-state-change
from it's PATH. The venv's bin directory is not part of the
default PATH of the neutron-l3-agent, hence the invocation fails.
This change adds the venv's bin directory to the PATH of
neutron-l3-agent.

To the best of my knowledge this is currently the only script
which is invoked and shipped by neutron itself [1]. Neutron expects
quite a few binaries in it's PATH, however other expected binaries
are typically system packages (e.g. radvd) [2].

Sadly, the PATH can not easily be extended, hence all non venv-bin
directories from the PATH are a 'one-time snapshot' from a quite
common set of directories across all common linux distributions.

[1]
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/search?q=%22cmd+%3D+%27neutron-%22&unscoped_q=%22cmd+%3D+%27neutron-%22
[2]
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/search?q=external_process.ProcessManager&unscoped_q=external_process.ProcessManager

Depends-On: I504a8270be1ddf2f24ab3ad3b4f2f4ca9c990470
Change-Id: I38bb573468dd4c57523cc1a5ff2448009ee2b216
(cherry picked from commit bf00f1d610cd3790ec32f2252e7bd2ecb4b10ed9)

commit_message:
Allow to pass some of systemd.exec flags

It may happen we have some shared directory mounted within
the container - if it is located in /run or in some other
tmpfs location, it won't persist across reboots.

SystemD provides the capability to create those directories, and
this patch allows to take advantage of this capacity.

Basically, we might add as many flag as we want.

Closes-Bug: #1814764
Change-Id: I5d2ef49ec205b7a43c488d4ceef0724e5ef2b6cc

This job uses a role in openstack-zuul-jobs, which is a repo that
used to be included in openstack's base job, but is no longer
now that we switched to the opendev base job.  This adds the repo

Change-Id: Id1efbde62e3e1e2ae4299f971d377c1c22989225

commit_message:
Add openstack-zuul-jobs to base-publish-tox-docs-static

This job uses a role in openstack-zuul-jobs, which is a repo that
used to be included in openstack's base job, but is no longer
now that we switched to the opendev base job.  This adds the repo
back to the role path for this job.

Change-Id: Id1efbde62e3e1e2ae4299f971d377c1c22989225

commit_message:
Update greenlet to 0.4.15

Over the 0.4.12 this provides the following relevant fixes:

- Workaround a gcc bug on ppc64
- Fixed support for ppc64 ABI
- Support for Python 3.7
- Support for MinGW x64

While there were also two new architectures added, no other architecture
had any code change.

Change-Id: I7931aa14b58be99fa1b2cfe4293b0c20770b65f4
(cherry picked from commit ec39ba394e19ac0e5aa917bf155ca91e51d5c7ac)

commit_message:
Update greenlet to 0.4.15

Over the 0.4.12 this provides the following relevant fixes:

- Workaround a gcc bug on ppc64
- Fixed support for ppc64 ABI
- Support for Python 3.7
- Support for MinGW x64

While there were also two new architectures added, no other architecture
had any code change.

Change-Id: I7931aa14b58be99fa1b2cfe4293b0c20770b65f4
(cherry picked from commit ec39ba394e19ac0e5aa917bf155ca91e51d5c7ac)

Cleanup rootwrap filters

Remove 'mmcrsnapshot' and 'mmdelsnapshot' since
they are no longer being used.

Change-Id: I2eb00fb1323d91d0834a222964b7db768207ba60
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Implement system admin role in users API

This commit introduces the system admin role to the users API,
making it consistent with other system-admin policy definitions.

Subsequent patches will build on this work to expose more
functionality to domain and project users:

 - domain reader functionality
 - domain member test coverage
 - domain admin functionality
 - project user test coverage

Change-Id: I19bf5a562401100d9208f98515ce596f7ca20185
Closes-Bug: 1805406
Partial-Bug: 1748027
Partial-Bug: 968696

commit_message:
Return WWN for validation in Pure Storage drivers

Return the volume's WWN in initialize connection. This is used by
os-brick for validating that the found devices have the expected WWN.

Change-Id: I107b0e2458bac5700e43e3740b6fc98ebac1f12e
Partially-Implements: blueprint validate-volume-wwn-upon-connect

commit_message:
PowerMax driver -  code cleanup and minor improvements

1. Refactoring of large methods
2. Metadata label changes
3. pylint fixes

Change-Id: Id1452ed31d0b0ed3e60d81cad3228825cae64af1

[{'created': '2016-06-13 10:07:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add content-encoding parameter to formpost middleware

The content-type parameter can already be set when uploading file
objects, for example as a hidden field in the form sent by the browser.

Sometimes it is also required to set the content-encoding of an object,
for example when uploading a gzipped logfile or html file; see [1] for
further reference. This patch adds this option and tests existing and
new functionality for content-type and content-encoding.

[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-14.11

Change-Id: I3dd47c7c999c29d62075955301fd763ad0b2c602
'}, {'created': '2019-02-06 00:08:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add content-encoding parameter to formpost middleware

The content-type parameter can already be set when uploading file
objects, for example as a hidden field in the form sent by the browser.

Sometimes it is also required to set the content-encoding of an object,
for example when uploading a gzipped logfile or html file; see [1] for
further reference. This patch adds this option and tests existing and
new functionality for content-type and content-encoding.

[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-14.11

Change-Id: I3dd47c7c999c29d62075955301fd763ad0b2c602
'}]
commit_message:
Add content-encoding parameter to formpost middleware

The content-type parameter can already be set when uploading file
objects, for example as a hidden field in the form sent by the browser.

Sometimes it is also required to set the content-encoding of an object,
for example when uploading a gzipped logfile or html file; see [1] for
further reference. This patch adds this option and tests existing and
new functionality for content-type and content-encoding.

[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-14.11

Change-Id: I3dd47c7c999c29d62075955301fd763ad0b2c602

messages:
[{'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-02-04 23:36:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-02-04 23:37:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-02-04 23:51:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

is it possible to raise the version of pip used in devstack?'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-02-05 00:30:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> is it possible to raise the version of pip used in devstack?

Good question! Per git history, the cap was introduced in this patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561427/. But the latest comment in the bug report seem to suggest that removing the cap will bring back the original issue. See https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1763966/comments/11. So downgrading virtualenv seem to be a slightly better option at this point, unless we want to wait for 16.4.0.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-02-05 00:39:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

hmm, commenting on that bug, but it seems like this is a temporary solution to a long term problem, devstack itself needs to be fixed to work with new pip at SOME point.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-02-05 01:25:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

this will be brought in by the next bot update, the way to prevent that is to add an exclusion to global-reqs'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-02-05 02:04:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-02-05 02:05:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
exclude virtualenv version 16.3.0

It is breaking devstack because of
https://github.com/pypa/virtualenv/issues/1301.

This is a temporary measure to unbreak devstack. In the long run,
we'll need to fix devstack to be able to use a more contemporary
version of pip.

Change-Id: Ic838ef692093c9b8059ddb7933dd700e1909d607
Story: 2004937

commit_message:
Remove hard-coded VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE from multinode docs

The default for VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE changes over time
and the docs referencing it are clearly not keeping pace so
rather than hard-code a default in the docs just remove it
since the doc already mentions the variable used to set that
size.

Change-Id: I4242584d13250872250689863d1b70c68594eefe

commit_message:
Huawei driver refactor(2/10)

Huawei driver code is terribly decayed and hard to maintain.
From this patch on, we'll try to progressively refactor total
Huawei driver, make the code more clear, reliable and maintainable.

This patch mainly optimized the huawei_smartx.py and huawei_utils.py
files and the logic that according to it.

Change-Id: I132b917e338d43da1e7b46127b1f228cefb1c16a

This commit introduces explicit test coverage for system members,
making sure they are allowed to do readable and not writable user
operations.

Subsequent patches will incorporate:

  - system admin functionality
  - domain reader functionality
  - domain member test coverage
  - domain admin functionality
  - project user test coverage

commit_message:
Implement system member role user test coverage

This commit introduces explicit test coverage for system members,
making sure they are allowed to do readable and not writable user
operations.

Subsequent patches will incorporate:

  - system admin functionality
  - domain reader functionality
  - domain member test coverage
  - domain admin functionality
  - project user test coverage

Change-Id: Ibc837225154ba7bcd2f93938565b41ff0e8f4803
Partial-Bug: 1805406
Partial-Bug: 1748027
Partial-Bug: 968696

The domains API already consumes system-scoped tokens is oslo.policy
is set to ``enforce_scope=True``. This commit introduces the system
reader role to the API, making it easier for administrators to
delegate subsets of responsibilities to the API by default.

commit_message:
Implement system reader role for users

This commit introduces the system reader role to the users API, making
it easier for administrators to delegate subsets of responsibilities
to the API by default. This commit also maintains the ability for
any user to be able to fetch their own user reference.

Subsequent patches will incorporate:

  - system member test coverage
  - system admin functionality
  - domain reader functionality
  - domain member test coverage
  - domain admin functionality
  - project user test coverage

Change-Id: I9c362e515772540dfa93d05781d955009b9a154d
Partial-Bug: 1805406
Partial-Bug: 1748027
Partial-Bug: 968696

commit_message:
Fix gigabytes usage error when deleting snapshot group

When deleting snapshot group,  the number of snapshots
is well decremented  with the number of snapshots present
in the group. But not the number of gigabytes.

Change-Id: I0fe6d4682a16cbe30e563079964a5275bac728bb
Closes-Bug: #1809434

commit_message:
Ceph-RGW: Update storage-init job application labels

This changes the application label for the ceph-rgw storage init
job to 'ceph' to match the other jobs defined for the chart, rather
than use 'ceph-rgw'

Change-Id: Ia0b679567161e91241250f0c250d24a45c5ebb92

commit_message:
Provides mount point as cinder requires it to attach volume

This patch provides a mount point which is required by cinder to
attach the volume to the baremetal, when the volume targets are
created for any node.

Story: 2004864
Task: 29107

Change-Id: Id2a2e071026b86a6fd586a998bf865b1ddb960d7
(cherry picked from commit 57037378bec5cd326f4d1efad5b0d4ba76322cc3)

commit_message:
Provides mount point as cinder requires it to attach volume

This patch provides a mount point which is required by cinder to
attach the volume to the baremetal, when the volume targets are
created for any node.

Story: 2004864
Task: 29107

Change-Id: Id2a2e071026b86a6fd586a998bf865b1ddb960d7
(cherry picked from commit 57037378bec5cd326f4d1efad5b0d4ba76322cc3)

commit_message:
venv: use inventory_hostname instead of ansible_hostname

It is possible that the hostname of the system does not match the
one in the inventory which means that the delegate_to or the
comparision to inventory_hostname will fail in the tasks later.

Change-Id: I8d4597c63eb6e1390b6f71630701fa74ae5cdef9

commit_message:
Skip repos if not handled by release management

Leverage the newly-introduced 'release-management' key from
projects.yaml to skip repositories in deliverables that are
not handled by the release-management team.

No longer maintain a local list of repository exceptions.

Change-Id: I0e5eab7a2aeb3bd09acf7bf01356a9f664530b0f

commit_message:
break out install-deps from quickstart.sh

Ensure the functions used to install deps in quickstart.sh
are reusuable by other scripts.

It's been well known that we want to break out and extend
the setup functions in quickstart.sh.  This takes a step
forward in that direction.

Details:
https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/571

Change-Id: I5abea36a133bc8b181b315f34eb0338d0a32c44e

subject: Remove fetch-zuul-cloner from base job
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 4162, 'name': 'Paul Belanger', 'email': 'pabelanger@redhat.com', 'username': 'pabelanger'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 9061, 'name': 'David Moreau Simard', 'email': 'moi@dmsimard.com', 'username': 'dmsimard'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-10-19 20:53:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-10-19 21:02:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

base-test (no fetch-zuul-cloner )
  http://logs.openstack.org/02/513502/1/check/tox-linters/14d6afa/job-output.txt.gz

legacy-base (fetch-zuul-cloner)
  http://logs.openstack.org/54/513054/9/check/windmill-ubuntu-xenial/bdad98b/job-output.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-10-20 11:33:07.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to zuulv3-jobs'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2017-10-23 22:27:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Let's merge this only after we've stopped including zuul-cloner on images."}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2017-10-31 15:28:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We need to be careful with this.
The fact that a job is *not* legacy doesn't mean it doesn't use zuul-cloner.

New, zuul v3 native jobs can end up using zuul-cloner somewhere down the line, for example inside projects' scripts in their repositories [1].

[1]: http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5C%24ZUUL_CLONER&i=nope&files=tools%2Ftox_install.sh&repos="}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-10-31 15:45:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

jobs that need zuul-cloner, should parent to base-legacy, IMO that is our long term path forward. So, if zuulv3 native jobs are still using zuul-cloner, this is a bug we need to fix.

How we fix it is likely up for debate, either projects can create a variant and setup fetch-zuul-cloner role in pre-run or create a compatible legacy- job which just patents to base-legacy.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2017-11-21 19:32:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As discussed in meeting:

19:31 < jeblair> #info 1) remove zuul-env from images now.   if that doesn't blow up:
19:31 < jeblair> #info 2) remove zuul-cloner shim from base immediately afterwords.
19:31 < jeblair> #info 3) if that blows up, fix those jobs, or temporarily revert 506 to add zuul-cloner shim back.  repeat as necessary.
19:31 < jeblair> #info 4) in the distant future, remove legacy-base (which will continue to install the shim as long as it exists)"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-29 16:07:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

This cannot land until https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/zuulv3-remove-zuul-cloner has been taken care of.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-03-07 02:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-03-07 02:44:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Everything outlined my monty should be done'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-07 06:10:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

No, it's not done - see lines 16 and following. This is not complete.

Monty, what are next steps here?"}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-09-08 00:52:38.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-12-17 19:40:51.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2019-02-06 21:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-19 20:53:36.000000000', 'message': 'Remove fetch-zuul-cloner from base job

This has been moved into legacy-base, as it represents zuulv2
functionality.  By moving it into legacy-base, we discourage native
zuulv3 jobs from using it, as it is not needed.

This promotes: If32a373cdb8a4899ccaa00d3c7df32fe76574f80

Change-Id: I912bf6ce941a92bdfc37f50f267fda892e2407de
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-03-07 02:44:28.000000000', 'message': 'Remove fetch-zuul-cloner from base job

This has been moved into legacy-base, as it represents zuulv2
functionality.  By moving it into legacy-base, we discourage native

commit_message:
Remove fetch-zuul-cloner from base job

This has been moved into legacy-base, as it represents zuulv2
functionality.  By moving it into legacy-base, we discourage native
zuulv3 jobs from using it, as it is not needed.

This promotes: If32a373cdb8a4899ccaa00d3c7df32fe76574f80

Change-Id: I912bf6ce941a92bdfc37f50f267fda892e2407de
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-06 15:37:32.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Allow [pci]alias to take a list

Previously in order to configure multiple PCI aliases, you had to repeat
the key:

[pci]
alias = {"name": "foo", ...}
alias = {"name": "bar", ...}

This causes problems for YAML-based deployers such as helm, because YAML
doesn't have a way to repeat a dict key [1].

This patch adds a hack whereby multiple aliases can be specified in a
list in a single `alias` key:

[pci]
alias = [{"name" : "foo", ...}, {"name": "bar", ...}]

The existing behavior is preserved: the above syntax is recognized and
properly parsed if and only if:

- The `alias` key is specified exactly once; and
- Its value is a list.

Previously, specifying a list as any `alias` value would result in a
JSON validation error.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-January/002224.html

Change-Id: Ie8dde9dafa3937a147ca74b0812fce8f5918171a
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Allow [pci]alias to take a list

Previously in order to configure multiple PCI aliases, you had to repeat
the key:

[pci]
alias = {"name": "foo", ...}
alias = {"name": "bar", ...}

This causes problems for YAML-based deployers such as helm, because YAML
doesn't have a way to repeat a dict key [1].

This patch adds a hack whereby multiple aliases can be specified in a
list in a single `alias` key:

[pci]
alias = [{"name" : "foo", ...}, {"name": "bar", ...}]

The existing behavior is preserved: the above syntax is recognized and
properly parsed if and only if:

- The `alias` key is specified exactly once; and
- Its value is a list.

Previously, specifying a list as any `alias` value would result in a
JSON validation error.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-January/002224.html

Change-Id: Ie8dde9dafa3937a147ca74b0812fce8f5918171a

commit_message:
venv: use inventory_hostname instead of ansible_hostname

It is possible that the hostname of the system does not match the
one in the inventory which means that the delegate_to or the
comparision to inventory_hostname will fail in the tasks later.

Change-Id: I9ec04c1ceb1036fcf2b830a372d6fb927b3040ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-06 07:19:11.000000000', 'message': 'py3: port object controller in proxy

When looking at the tuple thing, remember that tuples are comparable
with ints in py2, but they do not compare like (100)[0]. Instead, they
are always greater, acting almost like MAX_INT. No wonder py3 banned
that practice.

We had a much of other noncomparables, but we dealt with them in
obvious ways, like adding key= to sorted().

Change-Id: I52e96406c3c1f39b98c1d81bdc057805cd1a6278
'}]
commit_message:
py3: port object controller in proxy

When looking at the tuple thing, remember that tuples are comparable
with ints in py2, but they do not compare like (100)[0]. Instead, they
are always greater, acting almost like MAX_INT. No wonder py3 banned
that practice.

We had a much of other noncomparables, but we dealt with them in
obvious ways, like adding key= to sorted().

Change-Id: I52e96406c3c1f39b98c1d81bdc057805cd1a6278

messages:
[{'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-08-09 21:26:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-08-09 23:02:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-10 14:46:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't know 'retry' will solve the problem.

I tried some retry mechanism by changing the code one or two years ago, but at that time this did not work. I had no enough time to investigate it then.

Do you know retry will help it?"}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-08-10 14:53:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

No I haven't tried, should probably have asked before trying to implement it. It's causing a lot of headache in the Puppet CI because this fails often requiring a recheck on all jobs which takes a long time."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-08-10 14:54:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

IMO should give it a go, do you know what could cause this? I haven't been able to see something in any logs indicating the issue and the keystone token is valid etc."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-11 16:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Is there any way to know how many retries are made by @retry decorator you add? I would like to know how the failure change with or without retry. Looking at the graface [1], tempest horizon failure happened two time in the last 90 days (the graph is 24 hour moving rate, so one failure affects at least for a day.)

[1] http://grafana.openstack.org/d/zwNINcSiz/horizon-failure-rate?orgId=1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-11 17:23:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I am trying to check the failure rate of tempest-plugin job in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591148/ but it is showing a good result so far (three consecutive success).'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-08-11 20:14:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

In Puppet gate it can occur several times a day, see today for example http://logs.openstack.org/86/589886/1/check/puppet-openstack-integration-5-scenario003-tempest-centos-7/2a39d41/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-08-11_13_05_27_870324

I haven't been able to find any logs indicating why this happens, I was hoping we could atleast add a retry for this scenario test and maybe one of the three attempts would work."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-08-11 20:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The retry decorator suggested here [1] does not indicate if it hits an retry, perhaps there should be a boolean parameter available to the decorator if it should output a warning on a retry failure.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/590578/'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-12 10:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

-1 due to the undefined decorator.
http://logs.openstack.org/19/590519/2/check/horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin/dcce871/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-08-09_23_37_02_796339'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-12 10:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Could you check if retry works or not before merging this by using Depends-On patch in the puppet gate?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-12 10:23:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> The retry decorator suggested here [1] does not indicate if it hits an retry, perhaps there should be a boolean parameter available to the decorator if it should output a warning on a retry failure.

You are the author of the tempest patch too.
Is there any reason not add such information?'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-08-12 15:09:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-08-16 05:32:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-08-16 22:04:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-08-20 12:37:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-21 15:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Honestly I still haven't understood why retry is needed. I am checking the tempest-horizon gate failure carefully, but the failure rate is low (2 failures in the last 30 days) [1]. I am not a fan of retry, but I am okay (so no negative score and +1) if other reviewers are okay.

In addition, what will be the criteria of dropping the retry decorator?
Is "Horizon Failure Rate" in grafana.openstack.org [1] a good source?
If you object this, could you provide a source, for example, a source which we can compare with and without the retry decorator?

[1] http://grafana.openstack.org/d/zwNINcSiz/horizon-failure-rate'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-21 16:09:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Could you test the failure rate in puppet-horizon is changed by this patch before merging it? Doesn't Depends-On work? I would like to check it affects the improvement of the failure rate in advance."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-10-04 12:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to horizon-tempest-bug-t'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-06 21:30:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-08-20 16:15:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-08-21 09:36:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

Could you add more details about your motivation of this patch in the commit message?

I'm actually not a fan of this decorator at a glance because I think a test case should pass everytime if it runs. So, I feel this decorator is just for a workaround. But I also feel this might be useful in special cases. Because of that, I think adding more details and use cases might be helpful to understand of this patch."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-08-21 09:44:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

The motivation is to use this for the tempest-horizon plugin [1]. The Puppet OpenStack project has major issues with the tempest-horizon test_basic_dashboard scenario test in our scenario003 integration test, it usually fails on the login testing [2] and a patch submitted and approved can take 2-5 recheck, sometimes even more, to get merged.

Our jobs take about ~1 hour to run so there is a lot of CI time wasted and a lot of time wasted waiting for patches to get merged because of this Tempest scenario failing.

We are deploying the scenario003 jobs on Debian, Ubuntu and CentOS and are seeing the same issue on all of them.

My hope is that we would be able to run the tempest-horizon tests with a retry decorator [1] in order for the job to try the login multiple times before giving up, causing several hours of CI and man-hours.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/590519/
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest-horizon/blob/master/tempest_horizon/tests/scenario/test_dashboard_basic_ops.py#L116'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-21 15:47:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

The most tricky thing is that it seems to happen frequently in puppet-horizon CI. It is NOT true in the horizon CI and tempest-horizon CI. As a horizon core I haven't been convinced to adopt the retry decorator (but I don't vote a negative score). 
Hopefully we would like to have a way to compare the failure rate with and without the retry decorator.... It will clarify when we can drop the retry decorator."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-21 15:52:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

The docstring and the actual code seem not to match to me.'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-08-22 06:59:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> The motivation is to use this for the tempest-horizon plugin [1].
 > The Puppet OpenStack project has major issues with the
 > tempest-horizon test_basic_dashboard scenario test in our
 > scenario003 integration test, it usually fails on the login testing
 > [2] and a patch submitted and approved can take 2-5 recheck,
 > sometimes even more, to get merged.
 > 
 > Our jobs take about ~1 hour to run so there is a lot of CI time
 > wasted and a lot of time wasted waiting for patches to get merged
 > because of this Tempest scenario failing.
 > 
 > We are deploying the scenario003 jobs on Debian, Ubuntu and CentOS
 > and are seeing the same issue on all of them.
 > 
 > My hope is that we would be able to run the tempest-horizon tests
 > with a retry decorator [1] in order for the job to try the login
 > multiple times before giving up, causing several hours of CI and
 > man-hours.
 > 
 > [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/590519/
 > [2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest-horizon/blob/master/tempest_horizon/tests/scenario/test_dashboard_basic_ops.py#L116

Thanks. I see your case. But I'm wondering, why do we need this in tempest/lib not in tempest-horizon plugin? And, I'm worried about this decorator is *too* useful to avoid an issue (as a workaround). So, I think we really need to care about this usage basically. Otherwise, retrying a test is just concealing a failure."}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2018-08-23 07:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

If some testcase often fails(e.g., test_dashboard_basic_ops), can we add the retry mechanism inside the testcase?'}, {'account_id': 27078, 'date': '2018-09-14 08:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-09-14 10:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-09-14 10:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-09-14 17:25:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> If some testcase often fails(e.g., test_dashboard_basic_ops), can
 > we add the retry mechanism inside the testcase?

+1, yeah. I think that's better for a workaround."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-10-04 12:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to horizon-tempest-bug-t'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-06 21:30:03.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add retry decorator

Adds a retry decorator which can be used to
retry tests if they fail because of assertion
errors.

Change-Id: I3a8a928320b8f95f326b39a5a8df1316adbcda14

commit_message:
Return 503 when account auto-create fails

...and save 500 for things that would actually leave tracebacks in logs.

Change-Id: I02b062ccabba0dcc1542d063e0538f0b1bbbbca9

commit_message:
Fix port dns_name reset

When external DNS service is enabled, use user's context to request
dns_name reset instead of using admin context. The dns record need
be found in user's zone and recordset.

Also add show_network to NeutronFixture as needed in functional
test given I621f5111d1cccf3dc2c2ea6767ce879bc286e42b has not been
backported yet in stable/queens.

Change-Id: I35335b501f8961b9ac8e5f92e0686e402b78617b
Closes-Bug: #1812110
(cherry picked from commit 1b797f6f7e99fdef380340d6fe29e4004be48781)
(cherry picked from commit d2662df48526a2a4ddcd4a7bdbb6108102fe8321)

We have an issue here - https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/master/rally_openstack/scenarios/neutron/utils.py#L888

It should be extended with simple line:

    // here I can find name attr https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/?expanded=create-trunk-detail
    trunk_payload["name"] = self.generate_random_name()

Otherwise, trunk object has an empty name attribute and Rally cleanup makes an assumption that it was created not by Rally process:

1) listing of resource https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/master/rally_openstack/cleanup/manager.py#L133-L134 (calling list method of Resource Object)

2) filtering https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/master/rally_openstack/cleanup/manager.py#L172-L176 (calling name method of Resource Object which returns "name" attribute of resource dict in case of Neutron Mixin)'}, {'account_id': 16845, 'date': '2019-02-06 15:18:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 40.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2019-02-06 17:49:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 40:

commit_message:
Add possibility to have private cinder volume types

When declaring cinder_backends in user_variables.yml, it
will create public volume types.

We should be able to add an option to set the volume type
as private. This commit add this possibility.

Note that this backport combines the two related patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/619264
- https://review.openstack.org/629815

Change-Id: I583ad08feb2293b14da8d6ccd42f8809f1f45b8d
Related-Bug: 1804438
(cherry picked from commit a04b6cb15e5727a5ac34b1f7cc8213273c86d57b)

Introduces variable neutron_dnsmasq_noresolv. When it is set to true,
no-resolv option will be placed in dnsmasq-neutron.conf.

If dnsmasq_dns_servers are not set, and neutron_dnsmasq_noresolv is True
dnsmasq will reply with empty response on DNS requests,
which may be used as a workaround of

Change-Id: I7764e0d6100a8327f84f78da64f10f8e1fa355b1
"}, {'created': '2018-12-18 14:06:02.000000000', 'message': "Adds ability to set no-resolv for dnsmasq.

Introduces variable neutron_dnsmasq_noresolv. When it is set to true,
no-resolv option will be placed in dnsmasq-neutron.conf.

If dnsmasq_dns_servers are not set, and neutron_dnsmasq_noresolv is True
dnsmasq will reply with empty response on DNS requests,

(cherry picked from commit 1d2d3d086dbbdc8d7387b6f71c0780d6df85ecb9)
