[{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2017-09-27 15:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-27 16:16:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-ironic-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/10/507910/1/check/gate-ironic-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/0f065a7//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 6m 05s
- gate-ironic-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/10/507910/1/check/gate-ironic-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/7dd28f5/ : SUCCESS in 6m 03s'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2017-09-27 18:05:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(8 comments)

Thanks Julia. I'd like to chat with you to see how this fits with the Get clean-steps spec (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/501511)."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2017-09-27 19:11:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I had a discussion with TheJulia on irc [1]:
- if this clean-hold feature has a use outside of the fetching of clean steps (for the GET ../cleaning/steps [2] feature), we should mention it, so that we make sure that the solution can address those needs.
- personally, i like the idea of generalizing the clean-hold feature to be a clean-hold clean step, since that provides flexibility in when the node would be in a 'hold' state. But I haven't thought about the implementation for this, and whether it might be too much of a change wrt the code, to accomplish this.
- wrt the GET ../cleaning/steps [2] feature, I believe this is a replacement for the proposed POST ../cleaning/steps API. This replacement though, is two requests from the user -- they will have to issue a request to put the node in clean-hold, then wait until it is in that state, then issue another request to get the node out of the clean-hold state. Which, to me, seems like a lot to ask the user to do, but maybe it isn't?
- I think that the reason folks wanted the 'hold', was to be able to get the list of clean steps, then based on that list, issue a manual clean request; the ramdisk would only be booted once. Going with the POST request in [2], the user's POST would boot the ramdisk once; then the user's manual clean would cause the ramdisk to be booted a 2nd time.


[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2017-09-27.log.html#t2017-09-27T17:38:00

[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/501511"}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2017-10-02 14:52:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Thank you Julia.'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2017-10-06 08:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Empty option value maybe cause Unity driver failed to initialize

If the value of list type option is empty, Unity driver may failed to
initialize.

Example:
unity_io_ports=
unity_storage_pool_names=

Change-Id: Ib5850d984bfd3651d308f448993251e9ec5a9460
Closes-bug: #1775518
(cherry picked from commit 2ecfd6144ba79334740407241c8fa5d7ad928840)
(cherry picked from commit c7f9d29e17523653b7d2f0eb2b109798235b6ebb)
(cherry picked from commit b8b5de985359fe07f235e8c10f375246b1608fbb)

commit_message:
remove noqa use of neutron.db.api

With the rehoming of [1] there should no longer be a need to import
neutron.db.api as per the bug mentioned in [1]. This patch removes
the noqa import of that module and bumps the min version of neutron-lib
up to 1.22.0

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625332/

Change-Id: I09e582d4ffb26d91357fb644cf39750846aaa89d

I believe I need to apologize as that format will work on python 3.7+ only, my bad.
python 3.5 (actually 3.2+) will not understand the timezone with the colon in the middle, so 05:00 needs to become 0500.
python 2.7 doesn't support at all %z in this way and the offset will need to be parsed manually."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-01-04 18:38:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(4 comments)

> I believe I need to apologize as that format will work on python 3.7+ only, my bad.
> python 3.5 (actually 3.2+) will not understand the timezone with the colon in the middle, so 05:00 needs to become 0500.
> python 2.7 doesn't support at all %z in this way and the offset will need to be parsed manually.

May be we should either use oslo.timeutils [1] or one of many 3-rd party date/time packages...

1. https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.utils/ocata/api/timeutils.html#oslo_utils.timeutils.parse_isotime"}, {'account_id': 29209, 'date': '2019-01-07 06:42:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

'}, {'created': '2019-01-24 07:49:25.000000000', 'message': "Introduce `convert_to_date`

These changes introduce `convert_to_date()`.
`convert_to_date()` converts ascii text time into the Python's `datetime`
object which is way more handy to work with rather than String.

A follow up patch to Change-Id
I479bc18f79c6c51644115671ef68a879a94d102e

Change-Id: I1b8efd0387e489e98c7a79e8612a6ad0cbcaf30e

commit_message:
Introduce `dateutil`

These changes introduce `dateutil.parser.parse()` to the sushy
which converts ASCII text time into the Python's
`datetime` object which is way more handy to work with rather
than String.

A follow up patch to Change-Id
I479bc18f79c6c51644115671ef68a879a94d102e

Change-Id: I1b8efd0387e489e98c7a79e8612a6ad0cbcaf30e

[{'account_id': 28082, 'date': '2018-08-27 09:00:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28082, 'date': '2018-08-27 09:07:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Please note that there is outdated information in releasenotes/notes/multivif-pools-1cec757c77a8c4f8.yaml

I'm not sure if it is okay to change the example configuration given there without breaking the release notes build. Any help would be great"}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-08-28 08:00:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think this will break upgrades.

Perhaps better to extend the current format to:
pool_driver: [pod_vif_driver1, pod_vif_driver2]
And then extend the set_vif_driver function on MultiVIFPool to account for being a list instead of a single value (and ensure backwards compatibility ofc)'}, {'account_id': 28082, 'date': '2018-08-28 08:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28082, 'date': '2018-08-28 08:15:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

How about introducing a new config option with different name (vif_pool.vif_pool_mapping) and depreciating the present vif_pool.pools_vif_drivers? 

When new config param is not used, we can fall back to old config param so as to not break updates.

I think introducing dict-of-lists syntax can introduce other consistency problems (like multiple pool drivers might include a common vif in their lists)'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-08-29 07:28:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

yep, perhaps it makes more sense. Remember you also need to modify the utils.py to ensure 'check_suitable_multi_pool_driver_opt is right after the change.
Also, there is another caveat. With the previous method, we were using _get_node_vif_driver to know the driver to use for a given pod (it was a label on the node). If that is not true anymore with this change, that needs to be updated too"}, {'account_id': 28082, 'date': '2018-08-29 08:07:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28082, 'date': '2018-08-29 08:09:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28082, 'date': '2018-08-29 08:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I have added a new config option and marked previous one for deprecation.

I think check_suitable_multi_pool_driver_opt() and _get_node_vif_driver are still okay because they already assumed the mapping was from vif_driver => pool_driver'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-08-29 09:10:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Code looks good to me, just a couple of nits.

In addition, please add a release note about the new config option (and the deprecated one), and update the commit message to also include information about the new/old config option'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-08-29 12:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-27 09:00:40.000000000', 'message': 'Use same pool_driver for different pod_vif_drivers

A single implementation of VIFPoolDriver can be reused by different
PodVIFDrivers.

This was not possible earlier as a single instance of
drv_pool was used by all pod_drivers, and pool drivers store which vif
driver they are handling. This means only the pod_driver which is
passed to drv_pool.set_vif_driver in the end is used (for a given
drv_pool).

Also, the mapping in pools_vif_drivers config entry is flipped, and is
now a dict from pod-vif-driver => pool-driver.
Earlier, it was not possible to use a single pool driver as keys for
multiple pod-vif-drivers.

By utilizing the scoping ability added by previous commit, independent
drv_pool instances can be acquired from base driver manager.

Change-Id: Id0137f6b1a78e7aa3e3d3de639a5e989f4fd408c
Signed-off-by: Yash Gupta <y.gupta@samsung.com>

Earlier, it was not possible to use a single pool driver as keys for

By utilizing the scoping ability added by previous commit, independent

commit_message:
Use same pool_driver for different pod_vif_drivers

New config option vif_pool_mapping is added and pools_vif_drivers is
deprecated. The newer vif_pool_mapping is simply inverted mapping of
pools_vif_drivers.
Also, with the scoping ability added in cb2d308f84, independent
drv_pool instances can be acquired from base driver manager.

Earlier as a single instance of drv_pool was used by all
pod_drivers. This meant only the pod_driver which was
passed to drv_pool.set_vif_driver finally was used (for a given
drv_pool).

Please see release notes for further details.

Related-Bug: 1747406
Change-Id: Id0137f6b1a78e7aa3e3d3de639a5e989f4fd408c
Signed-off-by: Yash Gupta <y.gupta@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Change NodeDataLookup type from string to json

The NodeDataLookup parameter should be valid JSON and we should
help the user by adding type checking for this early in the
deployment so that the user doesn't experience the related bug.

Change-Id: Id9d2208f1cbaba9234d7657420cd7efcad3507a0
Related-Bug: #1784967
Related-Bug: #1814070
(cherry picked from commit fe2fda491b1ed97dcc77b3bf3f2df1df7b94493b)

Due to the stable policy, we do not develop directly against the stable branches.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-12-18 22:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

That said, I would be more than happy to work on a better approach. We ran into significant performance issues using the ORM both between the number of round trips or the amount of data that was being pulled back and a less than optimal query.
This was a compromise to get a fix out fast as users we experiencing severe performance problems. I have also built a quick/dirty stress test tool that was used to build this query.
Please feel free to join us in #openstack-lbaas if you would like to chat about it.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2018-12-18 23:34:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-12 22:16:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix health manager performance regression

When running stress tests against the Octavia Health Manager it was
observed that the scalability and performance of the health manager has
degraded.
It was observed that the ORM layer was forming poorly optimized queries,
putting excessive load on the database engine and unnecessary code paths
were executing for each heartbeat message.
This patch optimizes the health manager processing of amphora-agent
heartbeat messages by optimizing the database requests, pool processing,
and event streamer code paths.

Story: 2001896
Task: 14381
(cherry picked from commit f13a2e654659055728f9d15f558606d9c57037bf)

Change-Id: If2f81129ca94882b42b04ddf5652ff03e8a48edf

commit_message:
Fix health manager performance regression

When running stress tests against the Octavia Health Manager it was
observed that the scalability and performance of the health manager has
degraded.
It was observed that the ORM layer was forming poorly optimized queries,
putting excessive load on the database engine and unnecessary code paths
were executing for each heartbeat message.
This patch optimizes the health manager processing of amphora-agent
heartbeat messages by optimizing the database requests, pool processing,
and event streamer code paths.

Story: 2001896
Task: 14381
(cherry picked from commit f13a2e654659055728f9d15f558606d9c57037bf)

Change-Id: If2f81129ca94882b42b04ddf5652ff03e8a48edf

commit_message:
Update spec template

Minor revision on the template:

* Change launchpad to storyboard.
* Remove the obsolete requirement on spec filename.
* Add a section named ironic impact.
* Update assignee section to have an other contributor.
* Remove some extra spaces.

Change-Id: I0970cd1de276ca01c228a617f9cd5a21f9e57052

as a signal for the run function to end process.
The run function is expecting a literal string.

"}]
commit_message:
Making ironic-python-agent able to stop with python 3.x

The agent stop function will write a byte string 'a' to the pipe
as a signal for the run function to end process.
The run function is expecting a literal string.
In python 2.x the byte string will automatically be converted to
literal, while python 3.x won't do the conversion, causing the
process to never stop.
This patch will fix that behavior, allowing the IPA to correctly
stop using python 3.x.

Story: 2004928
Task: 29308
Change-Id: Iad16e8bed2436d961dea8ddaec1c2724225b4097

commit_message:
Correct "changed" to work with the latest ansible

This commit adds a check for "changed" in the return from the copy
module. If the value is not possitive `rc['changed']` will be set
with the constant "changed" from within the action plugin.

Change-Id: Id65e6e57d174c4c25d99836b09ad049302d4e42c
Signed-off-by: cloudnull <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Fix functional tests on stable/queens

octavia-tox-functional was migrated to openstack-tox-functional and
removed from the octavia jobs. Unfortunately the stable/queens branch
missed this change. That means that only the coverage job was running
the functional tests. This patch corrects that.

Change-Id: Ibcf6efd9ab195d90ac2141668e7fb5992ff64557

commit_message:
Use ansible git task so we can set umask

Today, when we use git clone from a shell task, we don't get the proper
umask setup. This makes are src folder on nodes 0777 by default.
Instead, we can use the git module, setting umask to 0o022 (zuul
default) so this process leaves the same directory permissions as
prepare-workspace role (rsync).

This was testing in:

  http://logs.openstack.org/21/596421/19/check/test2/e6c4ec1/job-output.txt.gz

Change-Id: I1c71f0eba4841fe9428078cbab71c7d0ac34a75c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fixup gate names after LBaaS v2 removal

As Octavia is now the only supported LBaaS option, we can remove
"-octavia" suffix from job names. Also neutron-lbaasv2 is removed from
required projects in base job definition.

Change-Id: I35abbb73249dd907b3b5055287624929b121afb3
Implements: blueprint remove-lbaasv2

Fix missing print format error

Missing print format will cause 'ValueError: unsupported
format character' error, this is to fix it.

Remove hardcoded 'localhost' references

This patch fixes two tests that fail if the barbican service
under test is not listening on localhost.

Change-Id: I541ee6a44bd86fbd963930dd2423fb9af833eec1

commit_message:
Allow cluster template being renamed

To get a better cluster template versioning and relieve the pain
of maintaining public cluster template, the patch is proposing
that the name of cluster template can be changed.

A folllowing patch/spec will be proposed to add a new field
'deprecated' to allow ops to hide old/deprecated templates.

Task: 26889
Story: 2003960

Change-Id: Id1db81d35bc3dccff0fac481be7801de200d52de

commit_message:
Fix the amphora noop driver

The dual-amp-down fix added an amphora parameter to the amphora driver
interface, but failed to update the driver base and the noop driver.
This patch corrects that oversight.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/634992
Change-Id: I7bd63c933f8e7cd10ff5c89fafbbb09e8cc9e3e1

WIP: Remove legacy playbooks

We now parent to zuulv3 devstack job, which allows us to remove a lot of
duplicate code.

commit_message:
configure-mirror: install unbound if missing

If our image doesn't have unbound installed, actually install the
package, don't error.

Change-Id: I6a9f4b1590eb4a140e576c0771d7dfec6f978afa
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-01 13:08:05.000000000', 'message': 'Clean unmanaged rules pushed by iptables-services package

As iptables-services injects default rules, we must ensure,
upon upgrade, that none of those unmanaged rules are present
in the firewall, nor in the iptables saved state.

We cannot remove them with puppet nor ansible due to the following
reasons:

- puppetlabs-firewall, the puppet module used in TripleO, manages
  the firewall resources with comments - the comment value is the
  name of the puppet resource. As the default rules have no comment,
  puppet doesn't "see" them as managed resources, and can't affect
  them.

- we can't simply "flush" all the rules and reapply them, because
  puppet does not manage all the rules - some are managed by neutron,
  for example.

- ansible "iptables" module doesn't make a full match of the chain,
  and might drop the unwanted ones, keeping the unmanaged in place.
  Also, it doesn't take care of the saved state.

SecurityImpact
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1667887
Closes-Bug: #1812695
Change-Id: I59733cb9a0323bbce4e20838a78103a70ec0d426

commit_message:
Clean unmanaged rules pushed by iptables-services package

As iptables-services injects default rules, we must ensure,
upon upgrade, that none of those unmanaged rules are present
in the firewall, nor in the iptables saved state.

We cannot remove them with puppet nor ansible due to the following
reasons:

- puppetlabs-firewall, the puppet module used in TripleO, manages
  the firewall resources with comments - the comment value is the
  name of the puppet resource. As the default rules have no comment,
  puppet doesn't "see" them as managed resources, and can't affect
  them.

- we can't simply "flush" all the rules and reapply them, because
  puppet does not manage all the rules - some are managed by neutron,
  for example.

- ansible "iptables" module doesn't make a full match of the chain,
  and might drop the unwanted ones, keeping the unmanaged in place.
  Also, it doesn't take care of the saved state.

SecurityImpact
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1667887
Closes-Bug: #1812695
Change-Id: I59733cb9a0323bbce4e20838a78103a70ec0d426

commit_message:
Fix regressions introduced by the plugin split

Few files in this repository lost the changes related to:
- the replacement of wget with curl when getting files from
  tarballs.openstack.org;
- the usage of portable shell statements.

Change-Id: I212bce3843f8305d0003c5b39f735ed97bbff62a

commit_message:
Catch directories we can not change ownership

When there is a directory where the owner can not be changed, we
fail and do not proceed to check the remaining directories. This
has been seen where netapp creates a special .snapshot directory
which is protected and visible when useing NFSv3, not visible
when using NFSv4.

This change catches the error and proceeds.

Change-Id: I2e61030c863041cd73cb204e31e423da3c6f6944
Resolves-Bug: 1814260
(cherry picked from commit 898154857501b09a0101d4b7d8cbbd2c4c8b64d6)
(cherry picked from commit aaf20f4a1f36ad548528a2b8926816f19ae2cd28)

commit_message:
Run nova_statedir_owner on every run

So far nova_statedir_owner step is only run on initial deploy or
when the image changes. This runs it on every deploy/scale/...
run.

Related-Bug: 1814260

Change-Id: I5eaaad9371183dff070d0eb72457fb76a6a60ebe
(cherry picked from commit efaf0c3bea07e64361390a2ac573552fe69715b4)
(cherry picked from commit ea6fc8f95da041636fa4e1ab7e3524ad5c9992ed)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-25 11:02:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix prefix for vip_ipv6

Currently we calculate prefix based on netmask when writing the vip
interface file. Since netmask has been converted to prefix in ipv6,
this patch will avoid converting it to prefix twice which could
result in a wrong prefix length.

Also fix a bug in another test that relies on osutils, but wasn't
mocking correctly.

Conflicts:
    octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/osutils.py

Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I9ee0cce12a975f4ab8f3df2707b355aab35c6cb3
(cherry picked from commit b2162c39a2017b12a59d2be745958a5fe3ad6403)
(cherry picked from commit 34fcaee9a7fccca2c3e159d97f7bca545d14d6ea)

commit_message:
Fix prefix for vip_ipv6

Currently we calculate prefix based on netmask when writing the vip
interface file. Since netmask has been converted to prefix in ipv6,
this patch will avoid converting it to prefix twice which could
result in a wrong prefix length.

Also fix a bug in another test that relies on osutils, but wasn't
mocking correctly.

Conflicts:
    octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/osutils.py

Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I9ee0cce12a975f4ab8f3df2707b355aab35c6cb3
(cherry picked from commit b2162c39a2017b12a59d2be745958a5fe3ad6403)
(cherry picked from commit 34fcaee9a7fccca2c3e159d97f7bca545d14d6ea)

commit_message:
OSH: Add Armada job for testing update of release uuids

This adds both a periodic and experimental job for deploying Ceph
and the OSH components via Armada. This job will then generate a
new release uuid, render an updated manifest for all previously
deployed releases, then apply that manifest to validate the
ability for all deployed charts to update successfully with the
new release uuid annotation

Change-Id: I6f2125f3505904c4714688e7a9900b8d6bea49b4

messages:

Is it worthwhile to chdir to somewhere else in run.yml? We could accidentally end up in KAYOBE_SRC_DIR and then we could end up relying on that for some playbook path.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-02-05 17:37:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Is it worthwhile to chdir to somewhere else in run.yml? We could
 > accidentally end up in KAYOBE_SRC_DIR and then we could end up
 > relying on that for some playbook path.

The working directory should be /home/zuul, as long as we don't explicitly change to the source directory it should be ok."}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2019-02-05 17:38:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-02-05 17:43:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2019-02-05 15:28:00.000000000', 'message': "Don't cd to /tmp in environment-setup.sh

This script is used by developers to activate the kayobe virtual
environment and source the configuration's kayobe-env file. A cd to /tmp
is an unexpected outcome of running the script.

To test the location-independent installation, remove the chdir from the
zuul job tasks that execute kayobe commands.

Change-Id: I59194952901fa648382489f48dc7aafb03d3a682
Story: 2004252
Task: 29347

commit_message:
Don't cd to /tmp in environment-setup.sh

This script is used by developers to activate the kayobe virtual
environment and source the configuration's kayobe-env file. A cd to /tmp
is an unexpected outcome of running the script.

To test the location-independent installation, remove the chdir from the
zuul job tasks that execute kayobe commands.

Change-Id: I59194952901fa648382489f48dc7aafb03d3a682
Story: 2004252
Task: 29347

commit_message:
Drop heat_stack_owner role

this role is not actually required since ~Kilo
I3f1b70b78b91bfac9af5fadb71140679b208c999
plus the heat chart already sets the trusts_delegated_roles option
for Heat to pass all roles to the trust

Change-Id: Icf900f318d3173d63c5967857d96f7d2a7f9aa5b

subject: Reinstate warnings-as-errors
messages:
[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-01 15:46:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-02-01 15:51:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

don't touch PO files.

The problem with -W is fixed already, see https://review.openstack.org/633968"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-02-01 15:51:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't think this is needed at all, let's drop it..."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-01 16:00:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> don't touch PO files.

Somebody has to. They have errors.

> The problem with -W is fixed already, see https://review.openstack.org/633968

That's not a fix; that's a workaround, presumably until someone resolves the actual problems, which this patch does. But now that I know about that patch, I can revert it in this one.

> I don't think this is needed at all, let's drop it...

If you look at the translated documents, you'll see real discrepancies in the places where the warnings are generated. For example, [1] renders "Anda dapat menemukan petunjuk tentang cara menggunakan Git di bagian :ref: git."

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/68/633968/1/gate/openstack-tox-docs/fb2a566/html/id/code-and-documentation/sandbox-house-rules.html#sandbox-git-repository'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-02-01 16:01:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

po files are handled in translate.openstack.org, any change here will be overwritten...'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-01 16:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-01 19:06:56.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from change-series-tutorial to fix-t9n-warnings'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-01 19:13:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> po files are handled in translate.openstack.org, any change here will be overwritten...

Then IMHO we should merge this to force the translations to be fixed the next time they're imported. Otherwise we keep compounding the problem."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-02-01 19:38:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

if we fix the RST files, the next import will remove the broken po lines.

I'm happy to import the RST change since it follows https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/rst-conv/references.html#external-references"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-01 19:44:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> if we fix the RST files, the next import will remove the broken po lines.

Okay, you saw [1] where I did the rst fixups.

But there were a lot more errors in the .po files - simple ones like extra whitespace around markup metacharacters etc. - which will only be caught if we can bounce them as soon as the translations are imported. What do we do about those?

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634479/'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-01 19:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-02-01 19:48:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Eric, best talk first with Frank as i18n PTL...'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2019-02-01 22:05:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

Hi Eric, many thanks for your findings. I really appreciate your work, but that change can't be through. PO files are auto-generated. There are two ways to modify the content: the source rst files and translation strings on Zanata. I changed already some strings in German based on your finding, which will be auto-imported from Zanata tomorrow. But there is no way to change the English sentence in the German/Indian po file, this must be changed in rst. Sorry."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-01 23:29:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks for the response, Frank. I changed the source strings in the .rst via [1]. Are you able to make the other changes in the translations (including the Indonesian ones) so we can revert the warnings granny switch?

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634479/'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-02-02 14:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Eric, I tried fixing everything in zanata, the next import (on Sunday) should include the fixes. Can you just submit the RST change, please? Happy to merge that one...'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-02-02 15:04:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

To clarify: I want the rst and tox.ini change.

Frank, please remove -2, we should take those two.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-04 17:42:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-04 17:43:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

This won't build until rebased on tonight's zanata import. At that point the commit message should be edited to fill in [7]."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-02-04 18:05:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

It builds already? Great! Let's merge...

Frank, please remove -2, this is not correct anymore"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-04 20:16:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> It builds already?

Ah, it probably builds because, since I changed the source, the translation layer isn't finding the (broken) translated section. commit_message:
Reinstate warnings-as-errors

There was a time when doc build warnings were ignored. During this dark
period, several translations were introduced that generated warnings.
These went unnoticed. Then, in a separate repository, the sphinx -W flag
(treat warnings as errors) was switched on. But still, nobody noticed,
because nobody made changes to this repository.

Then came the day when someone did [1][2]. And their patches wouldn't
build. And they were sad.

So a workaround [3] was instated whereby, for this repository,
warnings-as-errors was switched off.

Then the broken translations were fixed [4][5][6]. And there was much
rejoicing.

So now we can reinstate -W, which will cause future borked translations
to break the build, enforcing appropriate discipline therein.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633939/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634333/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633968/
[4] https://review.openstack.org/634545
[5] https://review.openstack.org/634592
[6] https://review.openstack.org/634638

Change-Id: I5e47a9147a59b0bcbaef116d8e4b91da0af806c5

commit_message:
Make links translatable

Follow https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/rst-conv/references.html#external-references
to make links translatable.

Also, use ASCII everywhere, instead of UTF-8 dash in one case.

Change-Id: I341d54de75a987361d64fdc11ac5c9a648401e12

commit_message:
Make the image pulling optional for tripleo-container-tag role.

The role makes possible the re-use of code at the time of tagging the
container images. However, the tagging varies whether we are deploying
the services or upgrading. In upgrade tasks we use this role to tag the
new container image (from the version we're upgrading to) into the image
being used by pacemaker. So, the value for the container_image
parameter is an image id, not an image name, which can't be pulled.
This patch adds a new parameter, pull_image, which is set to true by
default and will allow us to skip the image pulling for the upgrade_tasks
case.

Change-Id: I6fc69f122b3f48064ed831cd622a617a02a28e02
Related-Bug: #1814104

commit_message:
Fall back to legacy networking for fedora-29

It seems something is broken with fedora-29 and network manager, we can
see it in the devstack job for nodepool. Currently, we only seem to be
succesfully booting a fedora image on limestone, by rolling back we
should get fedora-29 booting on the other providers until we can better
debug.

Add 79-simple-init post-install script to add back legacy networking
scripts.

Change-Id: I0086ce3a97112b3290da1158b2c4a18f873f04a9
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

Add job for testing Ironic in the Overcloud

Using tenant networks with networking-ansible.

commit_message:
Setup Ironic in Overcloud

Set up resources on the overcloud so that ironic
can be used to deploy baremetal.
- Add IPA deploy kernel/ramdisk image
- Add a cirros wholedisk image
- Create a provisioning network
- Adds baremetal nodes
- Updates the flavor user by ironic

Change-Id: I1dc1f121b937f73d89d3f1ae8511f36cb526b2a8

commit_message:
func tests: Be willing to retry PUTs

We've seen a lot of gate failures that involve one or just a couple of
tests dying with something like

  Captured traceback:
  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      Traceback (most recent call last):
        File "test/functional/tests.py", line 562, in testFileListingLimitMarkerPrefix
          self.assertTrue(file_item.write_random())
        File "test/functional/swift_test_client.py", line 1069, in write_random
          if not self.write(data, hdrs=hdrs, parms=parms, cfg=cfg):
        File "test/functional/swift_test_client.py", line 1047, in write
          self.conn.make_path(self.path))
      test.functional.swift_test_client.ResponseError: 503: 'Service Unavailable'

Let's give it a couple retries, see if we can make the gate more
reliable.

Change-Id: I90a319943e948ac7df86cb29046f711adbb2fe20

commit_message:
Pin rabbitmq-server for ubuntu

Ubuntu is also affected by the new rabbitmq server version mismatch
with erlang. Pin it to last known working version until the packaging
mess is fixed.

Change-Id: I5e3ba7762f0990718e4180ffcd3db7722edc17b4
Related-bug: #1814233

commit_message:
Add barbican scenario for symmetric secret

Add BarbicanSecrets.create_symmetric_and_delete
scenario to create a symmetric secret. User can
specify payload, algorithm, bit_length, and mode
used for the scenario.

Change-Id: I5c5ca847f8b96de94654e16c37e11437e462c3f6
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-02-01 14:59:04.000000000', 'message': "Set /var/lib/mistral/undercloud.conf vol as rw in mistral-executor.

As we are changing the ownership of the whole /var/lib/mistral directory in a
recursive way, we can't be mapping /var/lib/mistral/undercloud.conf as read-only,
otherwise we will get a OSError: [Errno 30] Read-only file system: '/var/lib/mistral/undercloud.conf'.

Change-Id: Icbdaaf628d996bac89a770426db97d556df4003a
Closes-Bug: #1814275
"}, {'created': '2019-02-04 10:15:58.000000000', 'message': "Copy undercloud.conf file during mistral-executor start up.

As we are changing the ownership of the whole /var/lib/mistral directory in a
recursive way, we can't be mapping /var/lib/mistral/undercloud.conf as read-only,
otherwise we will get a OSError: [Errno 30] Read-only file system: '/var/lib/mistral/undercloud.conf'.

Instead, we will be copying the undercloud.conf file into /var/lib/mistral/ container
directory on start up, this way we will get rid of ownership permission issues.

Change-Id: Icbdaaf628d996bac89a770426db97d556df4003a
Closes-Bug: #1814275
"}, {'created': '2019-02-05 09:10:49.000000000', 'message': "Copy undercloud.conf file during mistral-executor start up.

As we are changing the ownership of the whole /var/lib/mistral directory in a
recursive way, we can't be mapping /var/lib/mistral/undercloud.conf as read-only,
otherwise we will get a OSError: [Errno 30] Read-only file system: '/var/lib/mistral/undercloud.conf'.

Instead, we will be mapping the undercloud.conf file into /var/lib/ directory
inside the container and then copy it from /var/lib into /var/lib/mistral
directory on start up, this way we will get rid of ownership permission issues.

Change-Id: Icbdaaf628d996bac89a770426db97d556df4003a
Closes-Bug: #1814275
"}]
commit_message:
Copy undercloud.conf file during mistral-executor start up.

As we are changing the ownership of the whole /var/lib/mistral directory in a
recursive way, we can't be mapping /var/lib/mistral/undercloud.conf as read-only,
otherwise we will get a OSError: [Errno 30] Read-only file system: '/var/lib/mistral/undercloud.conf'.

Instead, we will be mapping the undercloud.conf file into /var/lib/ directory
inside the container and then copy it from /var/lib into /var/lib/mistral
directory on start up, this way we will get rid of ownership permission issues.

Change-Id: Icbdaaf628d996bac89a770426db97d556df4003a
Closes-Bug: #1814275

commit_message:
Ensure rbd auth fallback uses matching credentials

As of Ocata, cinder config is preferred for rbd auth values with a
fallback to nova values [1]. The fallback path, for the case when
rbd_user is configured in cinder.conf and rbd_secret_uuid is not
configured in cinder.conf, results in the mismatched use of cinder
rbd_user with nova rbd_secret_uuid.

This fixes that fallback path to use nova rbd_user from nova.conf
with rbd_secret_uuid from nova.conf.

[1] See commit f2d27f6a8afb62815fb6a885bd4f8ae4ed287fd3

Thanks to David Ames for this fix.

Change-Id: Ieba216275c07ab16414065ee47e66915e9e9477d
Co-Authored-By: David Ames <david.ames@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: #1809454
(cherry picked from commit 47b7c4f3cc582bf463fd0c796df84736a0074f48)
(cherry picked from commit f5d8ee1bfc3b7b9f1a25f85b42e207db0c9f4b04)
(cherry picked from commit accef50f9648dc40f1a6f457f83f5359e9dd2a24)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-17 16:40:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add an empty network-allocation.yml

If running one of the kayobe <seed|seed hypervisor|overcloud> host
configure commands, and etc/kayobe/network-allocation.yml does not exist
in kayobe-config, the IPs allocated in ip-allocation.yml will not be
picked up and applied when the network.yml playbook is run.

This change adds an empty network-allocation.yml file to the etc/kayobe
directory, which will eventually end up in the kayobe-config repository.

Change-Id: I15529398aef5e21049182b0edc11816876331113
Story: 2004800
Task: 28953
'}, {'created': '2019-02-05 14:22:39.000000000', 'message': 'Allocate IPs separately from configuring network

When running one of the `kayobe <seed|seed hypervisor|overcloud> host
configure` commands, in some cases an IP address that is allocated by
the ip-allocation.yml playbook fails to be picked up by the network.yml
playbook, which uses the address 0.0.0.0 instead.

Running ip-allocation.yml separately ensures that the correct IP is used
by network.yml.

Change-Id: I15529398aef5e21049182b0edc11816876331113
Story: 2004800
Task: 28953
'}]
commit_message:
Allocate IPs separately from configuring network

When running one of the `kayobe <seed|seed hypervisor|overcloud> host
configure` commands, in some cases an IP address that is allocated by
the ip-allocation.yml playbook fails to be picked up by the network.yml
playbook, which uses the address 0.0.0.0 instead.

Running ip-allocation.yml separately ensures that the correct IP is used
by network.yml.

Change-Id: I15529398aef5e21049182b0edc11816876331113
Story: 2004800
Task: 28953

commit_message:
Catch directories we can not change ownership

When there is a directory where the owner can not be changed, we
fail and do not proceed to check the remaining directories. This
has been seen where netapp creates a special .snapshot directory
which is protected and visible when useing NFSv3, not visible
when using NFSv4.

This change catches the error and proceeds.

Change-Id: I2e61030c863041cd73cb204e31e423da3c6f6944
Resolves-Bug: 1814260
(cherry picked from commit 898154857501b09a0101d4b7d8cbbd2c4c8b64d6)

commit_message:
Run nova_statedir_owner on every run

So far nova_statedir_owner step is only run on initial deploy or
when the image changes. This runs it on every deploy/scale/...
run.

Related-Bug: 1814260

Change-Id: I5eaaad9371183dff070d0eb72457fb76a6a60ebe
(cherry picked from commit efaf0c3bea07e64361390a2ac573552fe69715b4)

Support configuration of yum.conf

Options are configured via the 'yum_config' variable.

Story: 2004935
Task: 29327

commit_message:
Set message property in ImageDownloadFailed

Set the correct property, "message". Looks like "_msg_fmt" may have
been erroneously carried over from some other project (Ironic?)

Change-Id: I2aa56da73660794c6dedcbb8a66e84bcec511a9c
Closes-Bug: #1808443
Related-Bug: #1799221
(cherry picked from commit 80fdc0a71b55659d92efdda826807d60d8bd4ab9)

commit_message:
Create tripleo-admin user on the undercloud

The resulting user home directory is mounted into the mistral-executor
container. A later change in tripleo-common will populate
.ssh/authorized_users with the generated private key so that
mistral-executor can manage the undercloud host via ansible localhost ssh.

Change-Id: I4c8ee04534636622581eb386c01790d6610e7f58
Partial-Bug: #1813832
Depends-On: Id89cc920e165c2103707609fd37639c3032cc8ea

commit_message:
Change NodeDataLookup type from string to json

The NodeDataLookup parameter should be valid JSON and we should
help the user by adding type checking for this early in the
deployment so that the user doesn't experience the related bug.

Change-Id: Id9d2208f1cbaba9234d7657420cd7efcad3507a0
Related-Bug: #1784967
Related-Bug: #1814070

commit_message:
Delete v2 gnocchi storage

This is part of a global effort to clean up CloudKitty's
unmaintained codebase.

This storage backend was only present for development purposes,
and not production ready. A second v2 backend will be implemented
in the future, with support for HA/clustering.

Change-Id: Iab9d152d2851ca385e607d338c0a09b74ba7e3b3
Story: 2004400
Task: 28568

commit_message:
Change the default storage backend to v2/influxdb

This updates the default storage backend from v1/sqlalchemy to v2/influxb.

Work items:

* Update default storage interface version from 1 to 2

* Update default storage backend from sqlalchemy to influxdb

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609986/
Change-Id: Icf3854f92b89be20077bbe7b9aac5ea13e3f9052
Story: 2001372
Task: 26825

commit_message:
metadata-agent: Remove 'ovs_integration_bridge' option

This option is no longer used as the source of truth for the
OVS bridge to be used by metadata agent will be OVSDB
configuration so we can simply drop it. For more information
please take a look at https://launchpad.net/bugs/1799216.

Change-Id: Ic8e377c7a3462c006bb645f0bbd0147b684c2998
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
LINBIT DRBDManage driver moves to maintenance mode

We are moving LINBIT DRBDManage driver to maintenance
mode and will be removed from the tree in T Release.

Change-Id: Ib8c4079429d1fea00be4e3993f48185da733d2c0

Converting the application tests to use flask's test_client

For each API unit test class, the methods are converted to use the
Flask app test_client context manager.
Change-Id: If00b829e684ee0928ebb89291ef59b86176e7f76

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-30 19:25:37.000000000', 'message': 'Add opendev/base-jobs to openstack tenant

This is intended to replace some of the jobs in project-config.
It shadows project-config, which means none of the jobs should
take effect at first.  However, as we remove each job from
project-config, the job in base-jobs will take over.

Change-Id: I3e6ac99f5b00977c5be80c6a3906b1de96d77df4
'}]
commit_message:
Add opendev/base-jobs to openstack tenant

This is intended to replace some of the jobs in project-config.
It shadows project-config, which means none of the jobs should
take effect at first.  However, as we remove each job from
project-config, the job in base-jobs will take over.

Change-Id: I3e6ac99f5b00977c5be80c6a3906b1de96d77df4

[{'created': '2019-01-28 14:49:26.000000000', 'message': "Add stable branches to rpm-packaging gerritbot

The rpm-packaging team manages their own stable branches and it is
useful to be notified of incoming changes on the stable branches, so add
it to the rpm-packaging channel's gerritbot config.

Change-Id: I02c3e00f07c70e46824b3a1b4ac5a6fe7680d18c
"}]
commit_message:
Add stable branches to rpm-packaging gerritbot

The rpm-packaging team manages their own stable branches and it is
useful to be notified of incoming changes on the stable branches, so add
it to the rpm-packaging channel's gerritbot config.

Change-Id: I02c3e00f07c70e46824b3a1b4ac5a6fe7680d18c

commit_message:
Fix release management ACLs for OpenStack-Helm

OpenStack-Helm is an official project team. It has not done
any release yet, but if it did, it should go through the
openstack/releases repository rather than directly tag or
create branches. Adjust ACLs to match.

Change-Id: Ie0d832ab1014d4165661c0484484a844de38ac9e

[{'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-10-30 15:41:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2376, 'date': '2018-10-30 21:39:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

some semantic/typo remarks and open discussions.

Good initiative though!'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-11-15 09:52:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(6 comments)

Hi maxime, Thanks for review! Please see inline comments. I'll way for your reply before doing a patch set."}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2018-11-16 09:07:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-11-16 15:10:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)

Thx for the review, see inline comments'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-11-16 15:49:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2018-11-16 16:45:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ok for microversioning with beta ... now that I think of it, would it not be interesting to look at the versioning model of kubernetes api ?'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-11-19 11:24:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd prefer to stick to semantic versioning, as it is more used in the python/openstack world: https://semver.org/#spec-item-11

Thus, we'd have v2.0.alpha.1 -> v2.0.alpha.2 -> v2.0.beta.1 -> v2.0.

Route will always be /v2/endpoint/subendpoint. Thoughts ?"}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-11-19 11:25:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

EDIT: v2.0-alpha.1 -> v2.0-alpha.2 -> v2.0-beta.1 -> v2.0'}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2018-11-19 13:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

OK, go for it.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-11-20 16:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2018-11-20 17:14:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Seems good to me.

Anyone else to review the spec ?'}, {'account_id': 29503, 'date': '2018-12-20 09:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I was okay with the new Flask/Flask-RESTful approach since the IRC meeting.

I also agree with semantic versioning approach.

Other points seem good to me.'}, {'account_id': 12015, 'date': '2019-01-06 17:23:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(14 comments)

Some quick comments. But I find this initiative very interesting.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-01-24 13:22:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-01-24 13:23:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(13 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2376, 'date': '2019-02-04 08:52:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Considering the whole lot of benefits that that new API will provide and the limited impact (no datamodel impact) it is a big +1 from me.'}, {'account_id': 9642, 'date': '2019-02-05 14:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-02-05 15:47:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
migrate manila-image-elements to in-tree job

The legacy-manila-publishimage-generic job is no longer used
since there is an in-tree zuulv3 job to build and publish manila
image artifacts.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/631846/
Change-Id: I923f36448791ddaa1d0fef281512648fa92631b6

commit_message:
Fix unused members deletion

Unused members are not being deleted from the pools. This commit
fixes the issue by associating the current target ports with the pool,
and removing the members not presented in these current targets.

Change-Id: I60ce63d2d50daf9a1cea9897dae4926137fc2352
Closes-Bug: #1812370

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 09:07:49.000000000', 'message': "Add method to generate device names universally

When attaching block devices, we find the next device name to use by
looking at the used device letters in the block device mappings and
selecting the next available letter, as long as the letter is within
'a' - 'z' or 'aa' - 'zz'. This allows us to represent 702 devices (and
would interestingly hit an IndexError if all 'a' - 'z' and 'aa' - 'zz'
letters were in use already.

This adds a method for generating device names universally, not limited
to any particular maximum, based on a device index. For example:

  vda(index=0), sdb(index=1), vdaa(index=26), sdabc(index=730), ...

This method and its helper method will be used in a subsequent patch.

Part of blueprint conf-max-attach-volumes

Change-Id: I2699f600a98222a4dc58903ec97ca70e57701c93
(cherry picked from commit 36f310f469b91c7de72a8366c7d493e1e7a4fd0f)
"}]
commit_message:
Add method to generate device names universally

When attaching block devices, we find the next device name to use by
looking at the used device letters in the block device mappings and
selecting the next available letter, as long as the letter is within
'a' - 'z' or 'aa' - 'zz'. This allows us to represent 702 devices (and
would interestingly hit an IndexError if all 'a' - 'z' and 'aa' - 'zz'
letters were in use already.

This adds a method for generating device names universally, not limited
to any particular maximum, based on a device index. For example:

  vda(index=0), sdb(index=1), vdaa(index=26), sdabc(index=730), ...

This method and its helper method will be used in a subsequent patch.

Part of blueprint conf-max-attach-volumes

Change-Id: I2699f600a98222a4dc58903ec97ca70e57701c93
(cherry picked from commit 36f310f469b91c7de72a8366c7d493e1e7a4fd0f)

commit_message:
Add method to generate device names universally

When attaching block devices, we find the next device name to use by
looking at the used device letters in the block device mappings and
selecting the next available letter, as long as the letter is within
'a' - 'z' or 'aa' - 'zz'. This allows us to represent 702 devices (and
would interestingly hit an IndexError if all 'a' - 'z' and 'aa' - 'zz'
letters were in use already.

This adds a method for generating device names universally, not limited
to any particular maximum, based on a device index. For example:

  vda(index=0), sdb(index=1), vdaa(index=26), sdabc(index=730), ...

commit_message:
step2: flatten the neutron service configurations

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration
for the neutron-metadata, neutron-ovs-agent, and neutron-ovs-dpdk-agent.

With this patch the baremetal version of each respective neutron service
has been removed.

Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

Change-Id: I7a918e72ce4bfd06a95d7a575603a6fb65ded5a9

commit_message:
Ensure we populate osd-devices with existing devices

If an older version of ceph-osd is deployed and then
upgraded to a version that keeps track of bootstrapped
OSDs, then the list of osd-devices never gets updated
with the pre-existing devices.

This change allows us to add existing, mounted Ceph
OSDs to the osd-devices entry in the local KV storage.

Change-Id: I940b108d914b39b55013a4617c3d17ff7122df60
Closes-Bug: #1814597

commit_message:
No longer test kata-containers in 3rd-party-check

Tests on kata-containers repositories were moved to the
Kata containers tenant, so we no longer need those
defined in the openstack tenant.

Change-Id: I34b9cc64b6d799abc9636d608bf51b7661d9ffeb

commit_message:
Remove way of running without kuryr-daemon

Deploying without kuryr-daemon is deprecated since Rocky and we
announced that it will be removed in the Rocky release notes. This
commit removes all the code that allows that, updates the documentation,
DevStack plugin and gates definitions.

Implements: blueprint remove-non-daemon

Change-Id: I65598d4a6ecb5c3dfde04dc5fefd7b02fc72a0cb

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-05 10:02:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unused members deletion

Unused members are not being deleted from the pools. This commit
fixes the issue by associating the current target ports with the pool,
and removing the members not presented in these current targets.

Change-Id: I60ce63d2d50daf9a1cea9897dae4926137fc2352
Closes-Bug: #1812370
(cherry picked from commit 66faa8a38bdb2c00a1fb3fdc9a78e701841b47c1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unused members deletion

Unused members are not being deleted from the pools. This commit
fixes the issue by associating the current target ports with the pool,
and removing the members not presented in these current targets.

Change-Id: I60ce63d2d50daf9a1cea9897dae4926137fc2352
Closes-Bug: #1812370
(cherry picked from commit 66faa8a38bdb2c00a1fb3fdc9a78e701841b47c1)

[{'created': '2018-08-01 21:44:10.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Rollback failed evacuated guest

This is a POC I'm just posting for discussion. Rollback
isn't trivial so it would require some more inspection,
and clearly need to handle rolling back volume attachments
on the dest and re-create those for the source host.

The bug reports that the instance is evacuated from host A
to host B and is spawned in the hypervisor, but then fails
somewhere else during evacuate on the dest host. Then when
trying to evacuate to host B again, it fails because the
guest already exists on host B so _check_instance_exists()
raises an InstanceExists error.

So if we've successfully spawned the guest but failed in
some other way, this adds a rollback method to destroy
the guest on the dest host whilst preserving disks on shared
storage and updates the port bindings to point back at the
source host.

Change-Id: Ib2ae341d9fb446a1589bf751fa0e025b49b7d3bc
Closes-Bug: #1784798
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Rollback failed evacuated guest

This is a POC I'm just posting for discussion. Rollback
isn't trivial so it would require some more inspection,
and clearly need to handle rolling back volume attachments
on the dest and re-create those for the source host.

The bug reports that the instance is evacuated from host A
to host B and is spawned in the hypervisor, but then fails
somewhere else during evacuate on the dest host. Then when
trying to evacuate to host B again, it fails because the
guest already exists on host B so _check_instance_exists()
raises an InstanceExists error.

So if we've successfully spawned the guest but failed in
some other way, this adds a rollback method to destroy
the guest on the dest host whilst preserving disks on shared
storage and updates the port bindings to point back at the
source host.

Change-Id: Ib2ae341d9fb446a1589bf751fa0e025b49b7d3bc
Closes-Bug: #1784798

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ib660c909b6b7afeb8edc6b802d5e6897d72f7980

commit_message:
Update cirros image version

The current cirros image version is 0.4.0.
As we have the image name hard-coded, it is required that we update it manually.
See [1] for reference.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521825/

Change-Id: I99a49975c5674991d84932ebd2c7ab6599d343ea

Migrate Dragonflow from Ryu to os-ken

This change causes Dragonflow to stop consuming Ryu in favor of os-ken.
os-ken becomes the reference implementation for BGP services and
Dragonflow no longer has a dependency on Ryu.
See [1] for reference in Neutron.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/607008/

Change-Id: Ifbf294f2f586cf765d20cfa60774c45aa735ca62

Force delete of VM on close

There are tests that fail because we are waiting for the VM to complete shutdown
In tests, we do not mind destroying the machine forcefully as there is no reason
to wait for it.

Change-Id: I5f8e4928ceb7b467af891835600cd8096ec88d2b

use payloads for SECURITY_GROUP BEFORE_DELETE events

This patch switches over to the payload style callbacks for
BEFORE_DELETE events of SECURITY_GROUP resources.

Co-Authored-By: Boden R <bodenvmw@gmail.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/597599/
Change-Id: Ie9163ad7baecf85e234e4253160f30015b43166b

commit_message:
Added help to gnocchi collector options

When re-creating the keystoneauth opts in the gnocchi collector
in order to add the deprecated group, the "help" argument was omitted,
leading to an uncommented option when generating the config file.

subject: Make devstack-tempest job voting
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-31 10:51:52.000000000', 'message': 'Make devstack-tempest job voting

Since the zuul jobs have been converted to the new format (see commit de4a38e),
the devstack-tempest job is stable. In consequence, this makes this job voting.
Given that the "cloudkitty-devstack-install" job was the same as the
devstack-tempest job without the tempest run, it has been removed in order to
put less load on the gate.

Change-Id: I942f9069eedce033b0b087992f8b84c76149ff1a
'}]
commit_message:
Make devstack-tempest job voting

Since the zuul jobs have been converted to the new format (see commit de4a38e),
the devstack-tempest job is stable. In consequence, this makes this job voting.
Given that the "cloudkitty-devstack-install" job was the same as the
devstack-tempest job without the tempest run, it has been removed in order to
put less load on the gate.

Change-Id: I942f9069eedce033b0b087992f8b84c76149ff1a

Install multipath dependencies when use-multipath is True

This change ensures that the multipath dependencies are installed
on the compute node when the use-multipath config flag is enabled.

messages:
[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-01-28 11:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-01-28 11:28:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Terry,

I've started this patch after the last error related to nesting transactions. Perhaps a parameter which allows us to opt out of nesting would be useful. 

This is just a small patch to collect some thoughts around that topic. Thanks for taking a look at it!"}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2019-01-28 11:31:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

Yeah great point Kuba. Thanks Lucas!
I think that from a user perspective, it's not too clear to use transaction vs create_transaction to decide whether you wanna go with nested or not but we may rename it or dup it with a more friendly name?"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-01-28 14:02:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-28 11:26:14.000000000', 'message': 'Allow for non-nested transactions

This patch is adding a new parameter boolean parameter called "nested"
to the transaction() method which would allow the invoker to explicit
ask for a transaction instance which atomic and not nested to an
existing transaction started by any external code.

By default, the transactions will continue to be nested so we do not
break any backwards compatibility for ovsdbapp.

Nesting is a good optimization but not always optimal/wanted in some
code paths plus, it makes troubleshooting of those critical code paths
much harder.

Change-Id: I938a2849ee246ed64bc3e72609cc3d125d41c41a
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Allow for non-nested transactions

This patch is adding a new parameter boolean parameter called "nested"
to the transaction() method which would allow the invoker to explicit
ask for a transaction instance which atomic and not nested to an
existing transaction started by any external code.

By default, the transactions will continue to be nested so we do not
break any backwards compatibility for ovsdbapp.

Nesting is a good optimization but not always optimal/wanted in some
code paths plus, it makes troubleshooting of those critical code paths
much harder.

Change-Id: I938a2849ee246ed64bc3e72609cc3d125d41c41a
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add ContainerImagePrepare service to ControllerStorageNfs role

While using ControllerStorageNfs role images are not pushed to local registry,
since ContainerImagePrepare service is missing in ControllerStorageNfs role.

Closes-Bug: #1814057

Change-Id: Iafe7bf37d7d04eed32a32b8881fab48fdc9f9dd6
(cherry picked from commit a2d0899f9c3eea9575a495b1d0eee3233b5df156)

subject: Fix Policy action "get_network_ip_availabilities" not found
messages:
[{'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2019-01-31 16:45:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2019-01-31 19:46:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

LGTM, but just wondering whether this "get_network_ip_availabilities" was ever being enforced by Neutron. If not, then this is a bug fix and we are good to go.

But if it did, then we will need to add a policy feature flag for this to ensure it tests the old way as well as the new way.'}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2019-01-31 21:28:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Felipe, It was in the policy.json file, but now neutron uses policy in code and they completely removed this policy'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-02-01 07:29:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

we do not error when wrong policy name etc? 

I mean why old changed policy name was passing on gate and why new policy name working on all stable branches job ?'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-02-01 07:47:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

this should raise error  - https://github.com/openstack/patrole/blob/3d6fd8ec33b020dd808dce2301812884dc610586/patrole_tempest_plugin/policy_authority.py#L162'}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2019-02-01 13:12:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ghanshyam, they are not passing, the job are non-voting. Take a look at the patrole-extension-admin job, it failed with Policy action "get_flavors" not found. Or check the same job but for the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634268/ patch, and you will find that it fails with  Policy action "get_network_ip_availabilities" not found.
Everything works fine in Patrole, we just was ignoring failing non-voting jobs :)'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2019-02-01 15:05:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Looks correct because this test was always expecting the wrong policy. Neutron is unique in that it is perhaps the only service that enforces the "show" policy for each entry in the list.

commit_message:
Fix Policy action "get_network_ip_availabilities" not found

The "get_network_ip_availabilities" policy has been removed since the Neutron
uses policy in code.
Patrole should test the "get_network_ip_availability" policy.

Change-Id: I068c96442f757eb765d147e161584c13f50bfe90

commit_message:
Role usage refactoring

Loading roles from config in one place. Fixing the issue with loading
roles from rbac_test_role and rbac_test_roles options.
Checking for admin role moved into RbacUtilsMixin class. In a stage when
the _init_roles is called It verifies the admin role ID for all roles,
including implied roles.
Added an ability to restore original roles if used pre-provisioned
credentials.
Modifying the PolicyAutority for taking a test_object to use is_admin
function in the _is_admin_context function.

TODO:
* unit tests
* functional test for pre-provisioned credentials ??? if i will figure
  out how to do this.

Change-Id: I4add0d24548163254f0e3051b38391dfe9948c28

commit_message:
Add missing glance parameter required for cinder store

For cinder backend of glance, to make the Image-Volume in the
internal project accessible from the Image service, few parameters
needs to be set in glance-api.conf.

In patch[1], support of few parameters is already added but
'cinder_store_auth_address' is missed out somehow, which is for
valid authentication service address. So, adding it in this patch.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626847/

Closes-Bug: #1809104
Change-Id: Ib19958577cdc4b829601018114ee0f564778c4da

[{'created': '2018-10-22 14:19:36.000000000', 'message': "Metadata agent: fetch ovn-bridge from OVSDB and not from config

Prior to this patch, metadata agent was fetching the OVN bridge
from the settings but this could lead to inconsistencies if the
config is different from the actual OVSDB configuration as
ovn-controller would be using one bridge and Metadata agent
another one.

In order to eliminate these inconsistencies, this patch is
changing the behavior of the agent so that it reads the OVN
bridge from OVSDB as ovn-controller does. Also, when the
agent is restarted, if the bridge has changed, it'll plug all
the VETH pairs to the right bridge and unplug it from the older
one (this is handy for the migration from ML2/OVS where an
intermediate OVS bridge is used temporarily).

Change-Id: I33f3509b8e5fe0398a27d35923e46f0409a1935d
Closes-Bug: #1799216
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Metadata agent: fetch ovn-bridge from OVSDB and not from config

Prior to this patch, metadata agent was fetching the OVN bridge
from the settings but this could lead to inconsistencies if the
config is different from the actual OVSDB configuration as
ovn-controller would be using one bridge and Metadata agent
another one.

In order to eliminate these inconsistencies, this patch is
changing the behavior of the agent so that it reads the OVN
bridge from OVSDB as ovn-controller does. Also, when the
agent is restarted, if the bridge has changed, it'll plug all
the VETH pairs to the right bridge and unplug it from the older
one (this is handy for the migration from ML2/OVS where an
intermediate OVS bridge is used temporarily).

The config option is not removed by this patch but ignored to
avoid issues when it doesn't match OVSDB configuration.

Change-Id: I33f3509b8e5fe0398a27d35923e46f0409a1935d
Closes-Bug: #1799216
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Raise appropriate exception

When the exception is of type VersionNotFoundForAPIMethod
the raise keyword is used without any exception.
This patch adds the code for raising appropriate exception.

Change-Id: Ia888530dca7a113d1e5ca4198458f7efda719efa

[{'created': '2018-12-09 03:54:48.000000000', 'message': 'Change openstack-dev to openstack-discuss

commit_message:
Update development scripts for control plane deployment

This adds support for deploying a virtualised control plane via Tenks, using
the Kayobe development scripts tenks-deploy.sh and tenks-teardown.sh.

Change-Id: I752455af9eb44cdb0f9921fd0c876fc2dfb50a5c

commit_message:
Fix IPv6 in Active/Standby topology

Load balancers with IPv6 VIP addresses would fail to create due to
a duplicate address detection issue. The keepalived process would also
crash with a segfault due to a known bug[1].

This patch resolves both issues and allows load balancers with IPv6
VIP addresses to be created in active/standby topology.

Conflicts:
       octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/agent_jinja_cfg.py
       octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/listener.py
       octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/plug.py
       octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/templates/plug_vip_ethX.conf.j2
       octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/templates/amphora_agent_conf.template
       octavia/tests/functional/amphorae/backend/agent/api_server/test_server.py
       octavia/tests/unit/amphorae/backends/agent/test_agent_jinja_cfg.py
Note that this patch was adapted for the stable/queens branch.

[1] https://github.com/acassen/keepalived/issues/457

commit_message:
Add support for tls-certificates relation

Add support for the charm to request and receive certificates from
the tls-certificates relation.

Note that this cherry-pick also selectively picks some changes
to support the restart_map/restart_on_change pattern implemented
in a wider change on master branch.

Change-Id: I821ad15aa6af7eaf9d22a00e7d3fb79611d4b6b5
Closes-Bug: 1776643
(cherry picked from commit 049993db1ba8c1555ea24bb91abf9617177e3765)

commit_message:
use common rpc and exceptions from neutron-lib

The neutron.common.rpc and exceptions were rehomed into neutron-lib and
are currently shimmed in neutron [1]

This patch consumes those modules from neutron-lib by using lib's
modules rather than neutrons. It also uses neutron-lib's RPC fixture
as needed in the tests.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586525/

Change-Id: Ifb35dd18bc8a410cd2e782c9f95167ff0a452d0b

commit_message:
Move UpgradeInitCommand and UpgradeInitCommonCommand to run by Ansible

This change moves the execution of UpgradeInitCommand
and UpgradeInitCommonCommand to be executed with
Ansible in the upgrade step 0 instead of Heat.

Closes-bug: 1812659
Change-Id: I76eb6a2572e24b6f114e38897a68cd85276af3c6
(cherry picked from commit 9164e6adbdce69a2b7c10e1aea6c5cb309b6754e)

subject: Update hook to remove old ceph.conf alternatives
messages: [{'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-02-05 07:24:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-02-05 11:14:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nLGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-05 07:24:56.000000000', 'message': "Update hook to remove old ceph.conf alternatives

When adding ceph-mon relation to cinder, the charm installs ceph.conf
with the update-alternatives via cinder_utils.resource_map().
However when the relation is removed, the alternative isn't cleaned up.
This can cause issues if installing a cinder-ceph subordinate charm.
The cinder-ceph charm also installs a ceph.conf alternative that will
point to the leftover ceph.conf installed by the ceph-mon charm.

Added remove_alternative() in ceph-relation-broken hook to ensure
that leftover ceph.conf alternatives is removed upon relation removal.

Change-Id: If9a8d460ee8209ef917fa55ec970379e9c741ec6
Related-Bug: 1778084
(cherry picked from commit e6a150c0d2894dadb870a4a356f1f9ab2336faa8)
"}]
commit_message:
Update hook to remove old ceph.conf alternatives

When adding ceph-mon relation to cinder, the charm installs ceph.conf
with the update-alternatives via cinder_utils.resource_map().
However when the relation is removed, the alternative isn't cleaned up.
This can cause issues if installing a cinder-ceph subordinate charm.
The cinder-ceph charm also installs a ceph.conf alternative that will
point to the leftover ceph.conf installed by the ceph-mon charm.

Added remove_alternative() in ceph-relation-broken hook to ensure
that leftover ceph.conf alternatives is removed upon relation removal.

Change-Id: If9a8d460ee8209ef917fa55ec970379e9c741ec6
Related-Bug: 1778084
(cherry picked from commit e6a150c0d2894dadb870a4a356f1f9ab2336faa8)

commit_message:
[WIP] force delete of VM on close

There are tests that fail because we are waiting for the VM to complete shutdown
In tests, we do not mind destroying the machine forcefully as there is no reason
to wait for it.

Change-Id: I5f8e4928ceb7b467af891835600cd8096ec88d2b

messages: [{'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2019-02-04 11:38:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2019-02-04 12:21:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2019-02-04 12:23:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2019-02-05 11:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nNot required, problem was elsewhere...'}]

[{'created': '2019-02-04 11:38:37.000000000', 'message': 'Update wait_until_none loop intervals

When we wait for only 1 second between loop cycles, we may choke
the system. We can wait for a bit longer (say, 5 seconds) to
avoid that.
Also, increased the default timeout from 30 to 60 seconds.

Change-Id: I6c78c16b8029b99748631733b33718faf0fa6eb8

commit_message:
Update wait_until_none loop intervals

When we wait for only 1 second between loop cycles, we may choke
the system. We can wait for a bit longer (say, 5 seconds) to
avoid that.
Also, increased the default timeout from 30 to 60 seconds.

Change-Id: I6c78c16b8029b99748631733b33718faf0fa6eb8

commit_message:
Migrate Dragonflow from Ryu to os-ken

This change causes Dragonflow to stop consuming Ryu in favor of os-ken.
os-ken becomes the reference implementation for BGP services and
Dragonflow no longer has a dependency on Ryu.
See [1] for reference in Neutron.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/607008/

Change-Id: Ifbf294f2f586cf765d20cfa60774c45aa735ca62

commit_message:
Update OXM_OF_PKT_REG to OXM_OF_PKT_REG0

Currently, there is an error when encapsulate NSH packet because
the parameter OXM_OF_PKT_REG does not exist.

Change-Id: I87643ec84b1bbfcb48c7ca156c3b8e4f6b019b4f

The code looks good for me. I will test it to give more comments. Could you please add a release note and some documents about the new tags and how to test this from an user perspective? Thanks for working on this.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-01-22 21:53:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-01-22 22:00:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

How to test this patch:

- Specify 'ingress_controller=octavia,octavia_ingress_controller_tag=latest' in `--labels` when creating cluster template.
- Test by following this guide https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/master/docs/using-octavia-ingress-controller.md#setting-up-http-load-balancing-with-ingress

After cloud-provider-openstack makes a new release, the WIP could be removed."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-01-31 01:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-02-01 10:42:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Support octavia-ingress-controller

- Add "octavia" as one of the "ingress_controller" options.
- Add label "octavia_ingress_controller_tag".
- Use external network ID in the heat templates.

Story: 2004838
Change-Id: I7d889a054cd5feb2eeef523b20607a6c7630d777

commit_message:
Support including and excluding files from config save

Currently in the upgrade job we are seeing the OOM killer kick in during
the 'overcloud service configuration save' command. Ansible is quite
inefficient when copying large files around, so excluding the large IPA
images should relieve some memory pressure.

Change-Id: I3a230b0a699154606ca8faa00a85d45ae815c599
Story: 2004704
Task: 28733

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-22 12:21:22.000000000', 'message': "Explictly start iscsid on bionic too for nova-compute

Recently iscsid was disabled by default on Ubuntu 18.04 (bionic),
and it may be on Xenial too, see:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/open-iscsi/+bug/1755858

On a local Bionic deployment with Python 3, the lack of iscsid makes
nova-compute fail with an exception when trying to attach a volume:

Invalid input received: Connector doesn't have required information: initiator

The additional start should not hurt even on Xenial. Maybe it could be
enabled everywhere; even if I didn't find a reference for it, a second
execution of `systemctl start` may be idempotent (and probably with
service too).

This does not seem to be an issue on CentOS 7 (but Python 2) where
the socket activation of iscsid seems to work, so maybe there is
another way to make this working. Also, the service could be
enabled, not just started.

Change-Id: Ifa995dcf8eb930e959f54e96af6f5fce3eac28ae
"}, {'created': '2019-01-22 14:44:36.000000000', 'message': "Explictly start iscsid on bionic too for nova-compute

Recently iscsid was disabled by default on Ubuntu 18.04 (bionic),
and it may be on Xenial too, see:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/open-iscsi/+bug/1755858

On a local Bionic deployment with Python 3, the lack of iscsid makes
nova-compute fail with an exception when trying to attach a volume:

Invalid input received: Connector doesn't have required information: initiator

Asking for the service to be started even if it is already running should not
hurt, so remove the check for the distribution.

This does not seem to be an issue on CentOS 7 (but Python 2) where
the socket activation of iscsid seems to work, so maybe there is
another way to make this working. Also, the service could be
enabled, not just started.

Change-Id: Ifa995dcf8eb930e959f54e96af6f5fce3eac28ae
"}, {'created': '2019-01-22 15:24:24.000000000', 'message': "Always start iscsid for nova-compute

Recently iscsid was disabled by default on Ubuntu 18.04 (bionic),
and it may be on Xenial too, see:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/open-iscsi/+bug/1755858

On a local Bionic deployment with Python 3, the lack of iscsid makes
nova-compute fail with an exception when trying to attach a volume:

Invalid input received: Connector doesn't have required information: initiator

Asking for the service to be started even if it is already running should not
hurt, so remove the check for the distribution.

This does not seem to be an issue on CentOS 7 (but Python 2) where
the socket activation of iscsid seems to work, so maybe there is
another way to make this working. Also, the service could be
enabled, not just started.

Change-Id: Ifa995dcf8eb930e959f54e96af6f5fce3eac28ae
"}]
commit_message:
Always start iscsid for nova-compute

Recently iscsid was disabled by default on Ubuntu 18.04 (bionic),
and it may be on Xenial too, see:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/open-iscsi/+bug/1755858

On a local Bionic deployment with Python 3, the lack of iscsid makes
nova-compute fail with an exception when trying to attach a volume:

Invalid input received: Connector doesn't have required information: initiator

Asking for the service to be started even if it is already running should not
hurt, so remove the check for the distribution.

This does not seem to be an issue on CentOS 7 (but Python 2) where
the socket activation of iscsid seems to work, so maybe there is
another way to make this working. Also, the service could be
enabled, not just started.

Change-Id: Ifa995dcf8eb930e959f54e96af6f5fce3eac28ae

commit_message:
Allow a cinder storage backend to set section name

If a cinder backend supports multiple attachment methods (iscsi
v FC), then it is useful to be able to differentiate this in the
sectional config as the volumes will also have this name set in
their metadata.

Change-Id: I4228c757a2eb4745a451de3473241b82941a1d2f

pipeline which causes S3 api requests to get a 403 error. This
fixes it.

commit_message:
Fix Queens+ S3 auth

Commit e92e8a7 changed the order of auth middleware in the proxy
pipeline which causes S3 api requests to get a 403 error. This
fixes it.

Change-Id: I11bb1e7e3ceeec9753ad6c86072287871a4eb703
Closes-Bug: #1814541
(cherry picked from commit 69caa6eb50f928bf6f20ea4da0e609c757a4a3dd)

commit_message:
[k8s_fedora_atomic] Delete floating ip for load balancer

When user creates LoadBalancer type service in k8s cluster, a floating
ip may be created and associated with the load balancer VIP. Magnum
now could delete the load balancers automatically in the cluster
pre-delete method, should also remove the floating ip as needed.

This patch depends on the github PR for cloud-provider-openstack:
https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/pull/433

Story: 2004836
Change-Id: Ia553aff4e66033346c6bfe120a72992bec79e136
(cherry picked from commit f63761a804b240dd0e33832e1e57d9cdb3873277)
